そも逢い初めし始めより
Since first I met you,...

〈他動〉To dye

to dye anything black
これを浅黄に染めて貰いたい

朱{あけ}に染める

to blush

to try―make a trial―make an attempt
失敗を恐れて指を染める者が無い
Apprehensive of failure, no one will make the attempt.

content:

content.content: 紺に赤の染め分け
blue picked out with red

2. (=始め)first

content.content: そも逢い初めし始より
Since first I met you,...

content:
そもそも〔抑々〕
〈副〉
1. (=さて)now

Now, this land of the Rising Sun is...
彼の成功はそもそも故ある哉だ
It is not without cause that he succeeds―It is no wonder that he should succeed―What wonder that he should succeed!
彼の大学者と認らるるそもそも故ある哉
Not for nothing is he acknowledged as a great scholar.

content: 2. (=第一に)in the first place; to begin with

content.content: それがそもそも間違っている
You are wrong there, in the first place.
それがそもそも失錯だ
That was a blunder, to begin with.
そもそもの始め、そもそもの起こり
the very first―the very beginning
日本で英学を学んだのは彼がそもそもの始めであった
He was the first man to study English in Japan.
日本で鉄道のかかったのは京浜鉄道がそもそもの始めであった
The Tokyo-Yokohama railway was the first line to be laid in Japan.
それがそもそもの病みつきだ
That was the beginning of the affair.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: そんなことはそもそも末だ
Those are minor matters―trifling matters.

content:
そや〔粗野〕
〈形〉Rude; rustic; churlish

content.content: 粗野な人だ
He is a man of rustic manners.

content:
そよう〔素養〕
〈名〉Groundwork; preparation

content.content: 何の素養が有る
to be grounded in anything
君は英語の素養が有るからじきに上手になる
You are well grounded in English, so you will soon speak it well.
素養無しに洋行してはなんの益する所も無い
Those who go abroad without preparations, are none the better for it.

content:
そよかぜ〔そよ風〕
〈名〉A light wind; a gentle breeze; a zephyr

content.content: そよ風に吹かれる
to be fanned by zephyrs

content:
そよぐ〔戦ぐ〕
〈自動〉To rustle; to sigh

content.content: 木の葉が風にそよぐ
The leaves rustle in the wind.
風が木の葉にそよぐ
The wind sighs among the leaves.

content:
そよそよ
〈副〉Gently; softly:(=する) to wave; to rustle

content.content: 風がそよそよ吹く
The wind blows softly―There is a gentle breeze.
木の葉が風にそよそよする
The leaves wave in the wind―rustle in the wind.
そよそよ風に吹かれる
to be fanned by zephyrs

content:
そよと
〈副〉Gently; softly

content.content: そよとも風が無い
There is not a breath of air―(陸上なら)―Not a breath of air stirs the leaves―(水上なら)―Not a breath of air ruffles the surface of the water.

content:

〈自動〉To blow softly; to blow gently

content.content: そよ吹く風も無い
There is not a breath of air―(陸上なら)―Not a breath of air stirs the leaves―(水上なら)―Not a breath of air ruffles the surface of the water.

content:
そら
〈間投詞〉There!

content.content: そら、言わないことじゃない
There! didn't I say so?
そら見ろ
Serve you right!
そらまた始まった
He is at it again.

content:
そら〔空〕
〈名〉
1. The sky; the air

content.content: 空に一点の雲が無い
There is not a cloud in the sky.
風船が空高く浮かぶ
A balloon floats high up in the sky―high up in the air.
屋根が空に届きそう
The roof is sky-high.
空飛ぶ鳥
the birds of the air
空の模様はどうか
How does the sky look?―How is the weather?
空模様を見る
to mark the signs of the weather
空の模様が変ってきた
The sky has changed―(と言うよりも通例)―A change has come over the sky.
空が晴れる
The sky clears.
空が晴れている
The sky is clear.
晴れた空
a clear sky―a smiling sky
空が晴れ渡る
The sky is lucid.
晴れ渡った空
a lucid sky
空が曇る
The sky becomes cloudy―The sky becomes overcast.
空が曇っている
The sky is overcast.
曇った空
a cloudy sky
今にも降り出しそうな空
a threatening sky
不穏な空
a lowering sky
男心と秋の空
Men are as fickle as autumn weather―(西洋では)―“Woman is as fickle as April weather.”

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 故郷の空を眺める
to look toward one's home
旅の空
to be away from home―an exile from home―a stranger in a strange land
心淋しき旅の空
Away from home, I miss my friends.
生きた空が無い
to lead a miserable existence―lead a dog's life of it
足を空に駆けまわる
to scamper about
(人にどう言われても)空吹く風と聞き流した
I took no notice of their remarks―gave no heed to their remarks―paid no attention to their remarks.

content: 2. (=上の空)absence of mind; absent-mindedness

content.content: 心を空にしている
to be absent-minded
人が何を言っても心を空に聞いておった
I gave no heed to their remarks―paid no attention to their remarks―took no notice of their remarks.
身はここに在れども心は空なり
I am here in body, but my mind is far away.

content: 3. (=しらぬ振り)feigned ignorance

content.content: 空を使う
to feign ignorance―pretend not to know

content:
〈形〉
1. (=嘘の)false; feigned; sham

content.content: 空涙
false tears―crocodile tears
空泣きする
to cry false tears―cry crocodile tears
空鼾
sham snores
空聾
feigned deafness―sham deafness

content: 2. (=無駄な)vain

content.content: 空頼み
vain hope

to entertain vain hopes―indulge in vain hope―hope against hope

content: 〈副〉(=で) by heart; by rote; from memory; without book

content:
そらす〔逸らす、外らす〕
〈他動〉
1. (=脇へ転ずる)to turn away; to turn aside; to avert; to divert; to deflect

content.content: 目をそらす
to avert one's eyes―turn away one's eyes―look away
顔をそらす
to avert one's face―look away
心をそらす
to divert one's mind―divert one's attention
彼は楯をもって飛び来る矢をそらした
He deflected flying arrows with his shield.
論鋒をそらす
to parry an attack
話をそらす
to divert the talk into another channel―change the subject
彼は一笑に付して話を脇にそらした
He changed the subject with a laugh.
彼はうまいことを言って人をそらす
He will put you off with fair words.
僕が何を言っても彼はうまくそらして取り合わなかった
He put me off and would not listen to me.
優しく出ると怒りをそらす
“A soft answer turneth away wrath.”

content: 2. (=人の機嫌を損ずる)to offend (one)

content.content: 彼は人をそらさない
He manages to keep on terms with everybody―He has tact in dealing with people.
人をそらさない応対ぶりだ
He has a tactful address.

content:
そらす〔逸らす、外らす〕
〈他動〉
1. (=脇へ転ずる)to turn away; to turn aside; to avert; to divert; to deflect

content.content: 目をそらす
to avert one's eyes―turn away one's eyes―look away
顔をそらす
to avert one's face―look away
心をそらす
to divert one's mind―divert one's attention
彼は楯をもって飛び来る矢をそらした

論鋒をそらす
to parry an attack
話をそらす
to divert the talk into another channel―change the subject

彼はうまいことを言って人をそらす

He put me off and would not listen to me.

content: 2. (=人の機嫌を損ずる)to offend (one)

content.content: この板に反りがある

to neglect―slight―be careless of―anything
人を疎略に扱う

これは貴重品だから疎略にせぬように

content:

content.content: 顔を剃る、髯を剃る

僕は毎朝髯を剃る

content:
そる〔反る〕
〈自動〉
1. (板なら) to warp; to spring:(刀なら) to be curved:(橋なら) to be arched:(檣などなら) to rake:(人なら) to lean backward

content.content: 板が反っている
The board is warped.
板を日に当てると反る
If you expose a board to the sun, it will warp.
板を日に当てたら反った
The board has warped through exposure to the sun.
枯れた材は反らない

この刀は反っている
The sword is curved.
橋が反っている

Steamers have raking masts.
君はどのくらい反れるか

伸るか反るか(やってみよう)

content:
それ

content:
それ〔其れ〕
〈代名詞〉That; it

content.content: それだ
That's it.
それじゃない
It isn't that.
それか
Is that it?
それならそれと早く言えばよいのに
If you want that, what don't you say so at once?
それでよし、それで結構
That'll do.
それで分かった(道理で)
That accounts for it.
それで安心
That is a relief.
それは困った
That's awkward.
それもそうだ
That's true.
それはそうさ
There is no doubt about it.
それはそうと君はなぜ学校を止めたのか
By the bye, why have you quitted teaching?
それはそうとしてまだ一つ問題がある
Apart from that, there is still another consideration.

content:
それがし〔某〕
〈名〉A certain person

content.content: 何の某様
Mr. So-and-so.

content: 〈代名詞〉I

content.content: 某{それがし}は存ぜぬ
I do not know.

content:
それから〔其れから〕
〈副〉After that; ever after; since then; ever since; then

content.content: それから三日目に逢った
I met him three days after―three days later.
それからまだ逢わない
I have not met him since then.
それから僕はここに居る
I have been here ever since.
それから彼はたいそう謹慎になった
He was very prudent after that―ever after.
それからどうした
What then?―What next?
(人の話の進行を促して)それから(?)
Please go on with your story.
(いったん途切った話をさらに続けるとき)それから
To go on with my story.

content:
それきり〔其れ切り〕
〈副〉That is all

content.content: 有るのはそれきり、それきりしか無い
That is all I have.
それきり会わない
I have not seen him since―I never saw him afterward―That was the last I saw of him.
彼はそれっきり姿を見せない
He has not showed him. self since―He never came after that―That was the last time he came.
つくづく懲りたからそれっきり止した
I heartily repented of it, and gave it up at once.
うんとうなって倒れてそれきりになった
He fell with a groan, and died.
取りつく島も無いからそれきりにしてしまった
I was thrown upon my own resources, and dropped the matter―let the matter drop.

content:
それくらい〔其れ位〕
〈副〉→『

content.content: それぐらい〔其れ位〕

content:
それぐらい〔其れ位〕
〈副〉So much; that much; about that

content.content: いつもそれぐらい有ればよい

英語がそれぐらいできればたくさんだ

それぐらいのことは誰でも知っている

content:
それこそ〔其れこそ〕
〈副〉(That is) the very thing; (that is) just the thing

content.content: それこそよかろう
That's the very thing―That's just the thing.
それこそお誂え向きだ
That is the very thing I want―That is just the thing for me.
そんなことをしたらそれこそお目玉だ
If I do such a thing, I shall catch it―I shall get into a row.
それこそ大変だ、それこそ事だ
There will be a scene―There will be a row.
そうしたらそれこそ走るだろう

そんなことを言おうものならそれこそ飲むだろう

そうなったら彼はそれこそ悦ぶだろう
Then he will be glad enough―ever so glad.
そんなことをしようものなら彼はそれこそ怒るだろう
That will make him ever so angry.

content:

〈形〉So trifling

content.content: それしきのこと
such trifles
それしきのことで怒るものではない
You should not get angry at such trifles.
それしきのことで落胆してはいかん

content:
それしゃ〔それ者〕
〈名〉A professional woman; a demi-rep

content.content: 根がそれ者だから如才無い
She is a demi-rep by origin, and is adroit in dealing with people.
細君はそれ者の果てだ
His wife is an ex-geisha.
それ者連
the demi-monde

content:
それじゃ〔其れじゃ〕
〈副〉→『

content.content: それでは〔其れでは〕

content:
それそうおうな〔其れ相応な〕
〈形〉Proper; suitable

content.content: 皆それ相応な見形{みなり}をしている
They are all properly dressed.
娘どもは皆それ相応なところへ縁づいている
The daughters are all married into suitable families.
人は各々それ相応の大望を持っている
Each man has his own ambition.

content:
それぞれ〔其々〕
〈副〉Respectively:(=の) respective; several; one's own

content.content: 甲と乙はそれぞれ五百円と三百円寄付した
A and B gave 500 and 300 yen respectively.
皆それぞれの席に着いた
They took their respective seats.
皆それぞれの家へ帰った
They went to their several homes.
皆それぞれ行く方へ行った
They went their several ways.
皆それぞれの地位に準じて恩賞があった
They were rewarded according to their respective ranks.
人はおのおのそれぞれの理想がある
Each man has his own ideal.
人はおのおのそれぞれの大望がある
Each man has his own ambition.
どんな物でもそれぞれよいところがある
Everything is useful in its place.
どんな人でもそれぞれ使い道がある
Every man is useful in his way.

content:
それだから〔其れだから〕
〈副〉That is why...; therefore; and so; so that

content.content: それだから来られないのだ
That is why I can not come.
それだから英語がうまいのだ
That is why he speaks English so well―That accounts for his English.
それだから困る
That is what troubles me―That is the trouble.
それだから言わんこっちゃない
Why, didn't I say so?

content:
それだけ〔其れ丈〕
〈代名詞〉That alone:(実用には)That is all

content.content: 僕の知っているのはそれだけだ
That is all I know.
有る金はそれだけです
That is all the money I have.
それだけのことさ
That's all.
何でも致しますがそれだけはご免だ
I will do anything but that.
何を持って行かれてもよいがそれだけは残してくれ
You may take anything else, but leave me that.

content: 〈形〉That much; so much; as much

content.content: それだけ有ればたくさんだ
That will do.
金がそれだけ有れば何でもできる
You can do anything with so much money―that sum of money.
金がまだそれだけ有る
There is as much money more.
先方でそうしてくれりゃこちらでもそれだけのことをしなけりゃならぬ
If the other party will do that for us, we must do as much for them.
忍耐すればそれだけのことは有る
Perseverance will not fail of its reward.
善いことをすればそれだけのことは有る
A good deed will not go unrewarded.
茶代をやればそれだけのことは有る
Tea-money will make a difference.

content:
それだのに〔其れだのに〕
〈副〉And yet; nevertheless

content.content: 彼の病気は酒だ、それだのに相変わらず飲んでいる
His illness comes of drinking, and yet he keeps on drinking.

content:
それだま〔逸れ丸〕
〈名〉A stray bullet; a random shot

content.content: それ弾にあたって死んだ
He was killed by a stray bullet―(他動詞構文にすれば)―A stray bullet killed him.

content:
それっきり〔それっ切り〕
〈副〉→『

content.content: それきり〔其れ切り〕

content:
それでこそ〔其れでこそ〕
〈副〉That's just like (some one)

content.content: それでこそ田辺君だ
That's just like Mr. Tanabe―I see Mr. Tanabe there.

content:
それでは〔其れでは〕
〈副〉Then; in that case

content.content: それではこうしよう
Then, we will do it this way.
それでは僕の方から行こう
In that case, I will call on you.
それでは困る
That's awkward.

content:
それでも〔其れでも〕
〈副詞、接続詞〉But; and yet; nevertheless; however; still

content.content: 彼は欠陥は有るがそれでも可愛いい
He has faults, and yet I love him―He has faults, nevertheless I love him―He has faults, but I love him none the less―I love him none the less for his faults.
こう言うと変だがそれでも本当だ
It may sound strange, nevertheless it is true―It may sound strange, but it is true for all that―It may sound strange, but it is none the less true―It is none the less true because it sounds strange.
この立派な文章は田中が書いたのだ、彼はそれでも学者じゃない
This fine composition was written by Tanaka, who, however, is not a scholar.
それでも泥棒じゃない、やはり政治家だ
Still he is a politician, and not a robber.

content:
それとなく〔其れとなく〕
〈副〉
1. (=何気無く) unintentionally; inadvertently; casually

content.content: それとなくしたことだ
It was an unintentional action.
それとなくしたをことがわざとしたように思われた
An unintentional action on my part was thought to be intentional.
僕がそれとなく言ったことが大問題となった
An inadvertent remark of mine gave rise to a great question.
彼はそれとなく言ったことであったろうが僕はそれを聞いてギョッとした
I was startled by what he must have said casually.

content: 2. (=暗に)darkly; obscurely; indirectly; obliquely

content.content: 彼はそれとなく家人に別れを告げた
He darkly bade farewell to his family.
僕はそれとなく意向をほのめかした
I obscurely hinted at my intention.
それとなく様子を探ってみた
I inquired into the state of affairs by indirect means.

content:
それとも〔其れとも〕
〈接続詞〉Or

content.content: あなたがおいでになるか、それとも先方で来るようにしましょうか
Will you go, or shall he come?

content:
それともまた〔其とも又〕
〈接続詞〉Or; and again

content.content: 今日おいでになりますか、それともまた明日になさいますか
Will you go today or tomorrow?
彼は来るかも知れぬ、それともまた来ないかも知れぬ
He may come, and again he may not.

content:
それなら〔其れなら〕
〈副〉If so; if that is the case; in that case; then

content.content: それなら行こう
Then I will go.
それなら僕の方から行こう
In that case, I shall call on you.
それならそう言えばよいのに
Then, why didn't you say so?
それなら待ちましょう
If that is the case, I shall wait.
それなら僕もご同様だ
I am another, for that matter.

content:
それなり〔其れなり〕
〈副〉As it was

content.content: あのことはそれなりになっている
The matter remains as it was.
それなりにしてある
We have left the matter as it was.

content:
それに〔其れに〕
〈副〉Besides; moreover; into the bargain

content.content: 彼は貧乏でまたそれに病人だ
He is poor, and an invalid, into the bargain.

content:
それにしては〔其れにしては〕
〈副〉Considering (the circumstances)

content.content: それにしては英語がうまい
He speaks English well, considering.

content:
それにしても〔其れにしても〕
〈副〉Still

content.content: それにしても安い
Still it is cheap.
それにしても帰りが遅い
Still he is a long time gone.

content:
それにつけても〔其れに付けても〕
〈副〉That reminds me of (something)

content.content: それにつけても案じられるのは妹の身の上だ
That reminds me of my sister's welfare.

content:
そればかり〔其れ計り〕
〈代名詞〉That alone:(実用には)that is all

content.content: 知っているのはそればかり
That is all I know.
何でも致しますがそればかりはご免だ
I will do anything but that.
何を持って行ってもよいがそればかりは残してくれ
You may take anything else, but leave me that.

content: 〈形〉So little

content.content: 残っているのはそればかりか
Is there only so little left?
そればかりの金で何ができるものか
What can you do with such a trifling sum?

content:
それはさておき〔其れは扨置き〕
〈副〉Apart from that; aside from that; independently of that

content.content: それはさておきまだ一つ問題がある
Apart from that, there is still another consideration.

content:
それはそうと〔其れはそうと〕
〈副〉Be that as it may; by the way

content.content: それはそうと君はなぜ学校を止めたか
By the way, why have you quitted teaching?

content:
それはそうとして〔其れはそうとして〕
〈副〉Apart from that; aside from that; independently of that

content.content: それはそうとしてまだ一つの問題がある
Apart from that, there is still another consideration.

content:
それはそれは〔夫は夫は〕
〈副〉How! very

content.content: それはそれはご親切に
How very kind of you!
それはそれは美事なものです
It is so very beautiful.
それはそれはお悦びでしょう
How very glad you must be!
その惨状と言ったらそれはそれはとてもお話になりません
The horrors defy description.

content:
それほど〔其れ程〕
〈副〉So; so much:(=の) so much

content.content: それほど欲しいか
Do you want it so much?
それほど会いたけりゃ会わしてやる
It you are so desirous to see her, you shall see her.
それほどの事でもない
It is not a very serious matter.
それほどの病気でもあるまい
It can't be a very serious illness.
それほどまで仰有るならお言葉に甘えます
Since you are so pressing, I shall presume on your kindness.
そうして下さればそれほど結構なことはありません
If you would do so, it would be all I could wish.

content:
それまで〔其れ迄〕
〈副〉
1. (未来なら)till then; so long; meanwhile:(過去なら) up to that time

content.content: ではそれまで待とう
Then I shall wait till then.
病人はそれまで持つまい
I am afraid the invalid will not last so long.
親父が来年東京へ来るようになるからそれまで伯(叔)父のところに厄介になります
My father will come to live in Tokyo next year; meanwhile I shall live with my uncle.
それまでは万事好都合であった
Up to that time, all had gone well.
それまでに
by that time
それまでには帰る
I shall be back by that time.

content: 2. (=程度なら) so far; to that extent

content.content: それまでは尋ねなかった
I did not inquire so far.
それまでは糺さなかった
I did not ascertain the matter to that extent.
せっかくそれまでにしたのを止めるのは惜しいことだ
It is a pity that you should give up what you have carried so far.

content:
3. 
〈その他〉

content.content: それまでは手がまわらない
I can not attend to such details.
君がいやだと言えばそれまでのことさ
If you refuse, there is an end of it.
遣り損なったらそれまでのことだ
If I fail, there is an end of the matter.
大審院で有罪になればそれまでだ
If the prisoner is found guilty in the Supreme Court, the decision is final―without appeal.

それや〔逸れ矢〕
〈名〉A stray shaft; a random arrow

content:
それゆえ〔其れ故〕
〈副〉Therefore; for that reason; that is the reason why...

content.content: それ故に辞職する
Therefore I must resign―I must resign for that reason―That is the reason why I must resign―That is my reason for resigning.

それより〔其れより〕
〈副〉From that time forth; thenceforth

content:
それる〔逸れる、外れる〕
〈自他動〉To turn away; to turn aside; to deflect; to deviate (from a course); to diverge (from a course); to swerve (from a course); to digress (from the subject); to wander (from the point); to stray (from the path); to go astray; to glance off; to miss(the mark)

content.content: 弾が的をそれる
The shot misses the mark.
砲弾が司令塔をかすってそれた
The shot glanced off the conning-tower.
船が進路をそれる
A ship deviates from her course.
人が踏むべき道をそれる
A man strays from the path of duty―swerves from the right course.
青年の心はそれやすい
A young mind is apt to go astray.
話が脇路へそれました
I have digressed from my subject―wandered from the point.
あの人の話はいつも妙な方へそれる
He always flies off at a tangent.

content:
それる〔逸れる、外れる〕
〈自他動〉To turn away; to turn aside; to deflect; to deviate (from a course); to diverge (from a course); to swerve (from a course); to digress (from the subject); to wander (from the point); to stray (from the path); to go astray; to glance off; to miss(the mark)

content.content: 弾が的をそれる
The shot misses the mark.
砲弾が司令塔をかすってそれた
The shot glanced off the conning-tower.
船が進路をそれる
A ship deviates from her course.
人が踏むべき道をそれる
A man strays from the path of duty―swerves from the right course.
青年の心はそれやすい
A young mind is apt to go astray.
話が脇路へそれました
I have digressed from my subject―wandered from the point.
あの人の話はいつも妙な方へそれる
He always flies off at a tangent.

content:
そろい〔揃い〕
〈名〉(=組)a set

content.content: 一揃いの道具
a set of tools―(家具なら)―a suite of furniture

content:
〈形〉
1. (=の)(=一様な)uniform

content.content: お揃いの着物
uniform dress
皆お揃いの着物を着ている
They are all uniformly dressed.
この着物を姉とお揃いにこしらえました
I have made this dress uniform with my sister's.
職人は揃いの法被を着ている
The workmen are in livery.

content: 2. (=釣合った)to match

content.content: 書簡紙と揃いの封筒
letter-paper and envelopes to match
礼服には揃いの帽子と靴が要る
I must have a hat and shoes to match my dress-suit.

content: 〈副〉(=で)(皆揃って)all together:(二人揃って)both together

content.content: 皆様お揃いですね
You are all together here―(二人なら)―You are both together here.
お揃いでどちらへ
Where are you going all together?―(二人なら)―Where are you going both together?
旦那様は奥さんとお揃いでお出掛けになりました
Master and mistress have gone out together.
これは皆さんお揃いでこれからどちらへお繰り込みですか
You are quite a party. What is the objective?

content: 〈接尾詞〉

content.content: 手揃い
to be full-handed
学校は手揃いだ
The school is full-handed―The school has a full number of hands.
学校は腕揃いだ
The school boasts a galaxy of talent.
あの家は美人揃いだ
There is a galaxy of beauties at that house.

content:
そろう〔疎漏〕
〈名〉Carelessness; negligence:(=な) careless; negligent

content.content: お前は疎漏で困る
You are careless.
書き方が疎漏だ
You write carelessly.
これは私が疎漏でした
I must apologize for my negligence.
疎漏の無いように
You must be careful―See that due care is taken!

content:
そろう〔揃う〕
〈自動〉
1. (=整う)to be regular

content.content: あの女は目鼻立ちが揃っている
She has regular features―classic features.

content: 2. (=一様なり) to be uniform; to be equal; to be even

content.content: 長さが揃っている、揃わぬ
They are of uniform length―of unequal length.
高さが揃っている、揃わぬ
They are of uniform height―of unequal height.
生徒の学力が揃っている、揃わないで困る
The students are equal in scholarship―unequal in scholarship.
品が揃っている、揃わぬ
The goods are of uniform quality―unequal in quality.
この米は粒が揃っている、揃わぬ
The rice is even-grained―uneven-grained.
足が揃う、揃わぬ
They keep step―do not keep step.
橈が揃う、揃わぬ
The rowers keep stroke―do not keep stroke.
額の生え際が揃っている
The roots of her hair are well-pencilled.
形は左右揃っている、揃わぬ
The figure is symmetrical―unsymmetrical.
この通りは家並みが揃っている
This street has a regular row of houses.

content: 3. (=完備する) to be complete; to make a complete set:(二つなら) to make a pair

content.content: 本は全部揃っているか
Do the books make a complete set?―Are the books complete?
全部揃わない
They are not complete―Some volumes are wanting (to complete the set).
いま一冊あれば全部揃う
One more volume will complete the set.
人数が揃ったか
Is the number complete?―Are they all here?
頭数がまだ揃わない
The number is not yet complete―They are not all here―Some are still missing.
もう三人来れば人数が揃う
Three more will complete the number―complete the party.
彼が来て一座が揃った
His arrival made the company complete.
これで顔が揃った
The party is complete―We are all here.
出品がまだ揃わない
The exhibits are as yet incomplete―Some of the exhibits are still wanting.
出品が揃った
The exhibits are complete―all there.
この靴は両方共揃っている
The shoes make a pair.
この靴は揃っていない
These shoes do not make a pair―They are an odd pair.
皆揃って押しかけよう
Let us go to his house all together!―in a body!
二人揃って行こうじゃないか
Let us go both together!―in company!―cheek by jowl!
兄弟が皆二人揃って来た
The brothers came both together.
両方共揃っている
(親なら)Both parents are living―(物なら)―Both are there.
兄弟が揃っている
The brothers are all alive.

content: 4. (=集まる) to be collected

content.content: この博物館は美術品が揃っている
There is a good collection of works of art in this museum.
あの学校は教員が揃っている
The school has a good staff of teachers.
役所は手が揃っている
The office has a full number of hands―The office is full-handed.
あの劇場は役者が揃っている
The theatre has a good company of actors.
品数が揃っている
The goods are well assorted.
あの店は品物が揃っている
They have well-assorted goods―They have a good assortment of goods―They keep a well-assorted stock―at that shop.

content: 5. (=釣合う) to match

content.content: 木口が揃っている
The timbers match well.
色合が揃わぬ
The colours do not match.
揃った夫婦だ
They are a well-matched couple.
揃いも揃った夫婦だ
Like husband, like wife.
夫婦揃って好人物だ
The couple are both good-natured.
揃った夫婦はめったに無いものだ
“Every couple is not a pair.”
揃いも揃った親子だ
Like father, like son.
よく揃った取組だ
They are evenly matched―equally matched―well matched.
皆揃いも揃ったばか者だ
They are a set of fools.
お前達は皆揃いも揃った弱虫だ
You are a set of weaklings.
兄弟三人揃いも揃って皆軍人だ
The three brothers are all soldiers.
教員は揃いも揃って皆学士だ
The teachers are university men, every one of them.

content:
そろえる〔揃える〕
〈他動〉
1. (=整頓する)to adjust; to arrange in order

content.content: (教室内の)机を揃える
to arrange the desks in order
(着ている)着物を揃える
to adjust one's dress
列を揃える(隊伍を整頓する)
to align the ranks

content: 2. (=一様にする)to make (things) uniform

content.content: 皆の服装を揃える
to make the dress uniform
長さを揃える
to make all of uniform length
高さを揃える
to make all of uniform height
足並みを揃える、歩調を揃える
to keep step―walk in step
人と足を揃える
to keep step with the others
ラッパに足を揃える
to keep step to the bugle
橈を揃えて漕ぐ
to keep stroke
声を揃えて
in chorus―in concert
声を揃えて歌う
to sing in chorus
声を揃えて唱える
to recite in concert
口を揃えて
in a breath―in a chorus―in a concert
皆口を揃えて質問した
They all asked in a breath.
口を揃えて彼を攻撃した
They all attacked him in a breath―in a chorus.
口を揃えて喝采した
They all applauded in a chorus―in a concert.
都下の新聞が筆を揃えて政府の処置に反対を唱えた
The town papers protested against the government's measure in union.
耳を揃えて百両
One hundred ryo in a lump!

content: 3. (=まとめる)to complete

content.content: 人数を揃える、頭数を揃える
to complete the (requisite) number―make up the number―make up a party
(道具など)一組揃える
to complete the set
道具を揃えなければならぬ
I must get a complete set of tools.―(は商売道具、家具なら)―get a complete suite of furniture.
馬琴の作を残らず揃えて持っている
I have a complete set of Bakin's works.
残らず揃えるにいくらかかるか
What does a complete set cost?
道具を一式揃えるに三百円かかる
A complete set of tools costs 300 yen.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: これと同じ品を二十だけ揃えて貰いたい
I want twenty of the same kind.
必要な本を揃えなければならぬ
I must provide myself with the necessary books.
必要な本が揃えてある
I am provided with the necessary books.
着物一通り揃えるには千円かかる
It costs a thousand yen to provide oneself with a good wardrobe.

content: 4. (=集める)to collect

content.content: 彼の家には名刀が揃えてある
He has a good collection of swords.
僕は万国の郵便切手が揃えてある
I have a collection of postage stamps of all countries.

content: 5. (=多くの種類を集める)to assort

content.content: 品数を揃える
to assort goods―assort a stock of goods
あの店には品数が揃えてある
They have a good assortment of goods at that shop.

content: 6. (=取合わせる)to match

content.content: 色を揃える
to match colours
木口を揃える
to match timbers
材木をこの木口に揃えて貰いたい
I wish you to match me this timber.

content: 7. (=品分けする)to sort

content.content: トランプの札を揃える
to sort one's cards

content:
そろそろ〔徐々〕
〈副〉Slowly; gently; gradually; by degrees; by slow degrees; little by little; inch by inch; by inches; at a snail's pace

content.content: そろそろ歩こう
Let us walk slow!―proceed at a slow pace!
そろそろ進む
to work one's way
そろそろ上がる、そろそろ下る、そろそろ入る、そろそろ出る
to work one's way up―work one's way down―work one's way in―work one's way out
遺族にそろそろと悲報を伝えた
I broke the sad news to the family.
工事はそろそろ進む
The works progress little by little―inch by inch―by inches―at a snail's pace.
彼はそろそろ快くなる
He is gradually recovering―recovering by slow degrees―slowly picking up―gathering up his crumbs.
そろそろ温かになる
It is getting warmer.
そろそろ明るくなる
It is growing light.
そろそろ出かけようじゃないか
Let's be going!―Let's be jogging!
そろそろ出かけようかな
I must be jogging.
今頃はそろそろわかったろう
The truth must have dawned upon his mind by this time.
この子はそろそろ学校へ出してもよかろう
It is time the child were sent to school.
お前はそろそろ親父の手伝いをしてもよい年だ
You are old enough to be helping your father.
そろそろこちらへもお鉢がまわって来そうだ
It will be my turn by and by.

content:
ゾロゾロ
〈副〉In an irregular file; in a stream

content.content: 人がゾロゾロ通る
People pass in a stream―The streets flow with passengers.
鐘が鳴ると生徒がゾロゾロ出て来る
When the bell rings, the students stream out of the school.
後からゾロゾロ付いて来る
They follow at my heels.
あの婦人は子どもをゾロゾロ連れて町を歩いている
I see her walking the streets, with her children following at her heels.
兵隊が市街をゾロゾロ歩く
The soldiers walk the streets in parties.

content:
そろばん〔算盤〕
〈名〉
1. An abacus

content.content: 算盤を置く
to use the abacus―calculate on the abacus
君は算盤ができるか
Can you use the abacus?
今算盤を稽古しています
I am learning how to use the abacus.

content: 2. (=計算)calculation; reckoning

content.content: そりゃ算盤違いだ
You are out in your reckoning.
それでは算盤が取れません
It does not pay―It is not worth my while―I find no account in it―I do not find my account in it.
あの人は胸に算盤が有る
He is a calculating man.
算盤通りにいけばそうなるはずだ
It ought to be so in theory.
世の中は算盤通りにいくものでない
Things won't go by theory―Theory and practice won't go hand in hand.

content:
そろばんだま〔算盤珠〕
〈名〉The counters (on the abacus)

content.content: 算盤珠を弾く
to move a counter
算盤珠を弾いてかかる(自分の利益を図る)
to look to one's own interests―have an eye to the main chance

content:
ぞろりとした〔ゾロリとした〕
〈形〉Loose-fitting; flowing

content.content: ゾロリとした身形{みなり}をしている
He is in a loose-fitting dress.
ゾロリとした着物
a flowing robe

content:
ぞろりとした〔ゾロリとした〕
〈形〉Loose-fitting; flowing

content.content: ゾロリとした身形{みなり}をしている
He is in a loose-fitting dress.
ゾロリとした着物
a flowing robe

content:
そわそわする
〈自動〉To flutter; to fidget; to be fidgety; to be restless

content.content: 全級がなんだかそわそわしている
The whole class is fidgety.
待ち人があるので家内中がそわそわしていた
The whole family were restless with expectation.
フランスの女はそわそわしたふうがある
A French woman has a fluttering manner about her.

content:
そん〔孫〕
〈名〉
1. (=まご)a grandson
2. (=子孫)a descendant

content.content: 天皇七世の孫
the Emperor's descendent of the seventh generation

content:
そん〔損〕
〈名〉
1. (=損益の損、損失)loss:(=する) to lose; to be the loser

content.content: 損をする
to suffer a loss―sustain a loss―be the loser―come off a loser―be out of pocket
この取引で損をした
I have lost by the transaction―I am the loser by the transaction―I am out of pocket by the transaction.
この取引で千円損をした
I have lost 1,000 yen by the transaction―I am 1,000 yen out of pocket by the transaction.
差引き千円の損になる
The balance is 1,000 yen to the bad.
買って損をする
to lose by buying
この品を買うと損するぞ
You will be the loser by these goods.
こんな物を買って損をした
I had a bad bargain in the purchase.
この品を買って損をしたら俺が背負う
I will buy the goods at my own risk.
損をして売る
to sell at a loss―sell at a sacrifice
この品は損をしても売ってしまいたい
I wish to sell the goods even at a sacrifice.
そう安く売っては損がいきます
I shall lose by selling at that.
ものを言うと損がいくというような顔をしている
He “has not a word to throw at a dog”―He is a morose man.
慾張るとかえって損をする
“Grasp all and lose all.”
損をするような危険を冒す(商売上の冒険)
to run a risk
損をするのはいやだ
I don't care to run risks.
少しくらいの損はかまわぬ
I don't mind running some risks.
彼は利口だから損をするようなことはせぬ
He is too prudent to run risks.
人に損をかける
to put one to a loss
損を償う、損を補う
to make good a loss―make up for a loss―compensate one for a loss
ご損をかけたら償います
I will make good your loss―compensate you for your loss.
損を重ねる
to sustain loss on loss
損の上塗りをする(泥棒に追銭)
to throw good money after bad
僅かばかりの貸金で訴訟を起こしては損の上塗りだ
To sue for a small debt is throwing good many after bad.
損を分担する
to share in the loss
大損
a heavy loss
丸損
a dead loss

content: 2. (=損得の損、不利益)disadvantage:(=な) disadvantageous (to one) ; unfavourable (to one) ; against (one)

content.content: この取引は御損になります
This transaction will be disadvantageous to you―It will prove to your disadvantage.
僕は損な立場だ
I am in a disadvantageous position.
損な条件で仕事を引受けた
I undertook the work on disadvantageous terms―on unfavourable terms.
英語を知らないとどうするにも損だ
One who does not know English is at a disadvantage in doing anything.
資本が無いと損だ
One who has no capital is at a disadvantage―A man without capital labours under a disadvantage.
外国人は何をするにも損だ
A foreigner is at a disadvantage―A foreigner labours under a disadvantage.
君はそんなことをしては損だ
You are acting against your own interests.
そんな議論をしてはかえって損だ
Your arguments make against your interest.
風采のあがらないのは損だ
An unprepossessing appearance makes against one.
彼は風采があがらないから損だ
His appearance is against him.
(談判など)長引くだけ損だ、延引するだけ損だ
Time is against us.
損をする人がありゃ得をする人がある(甲の損は乙の得)
“It is an ill wind that blows nobody good.”
損して得取れ
“Make the best of a bad bargain.”
正直に損無し
Honesty pays―“Honesty is the best policy.”
小買いは損だ
It does not pay to buy anything in small quantities.
どっちへ転んでも損は無い
You will come off a gainer in either case.
欠席裁判は損なもの
“The absent party is always to blame.”
あんな処へ行って損をした
I went on a fool's errand.
今日は傘を持って来て損をした
My umbrella has proved of no service today.
悪筆は一生の損
Bad handwriting is a lifelong curse.
僕は損な性分だ、損な質だ、損な人間だ
I am not favoured by nature―I am not Nature's favourite.
彼は内気で損な性分だ
He stands in his own light through timidity.
僕は憎まれ役で損な役だ
I must play the unwelcome part of martinet.

content: 〈接尾詞〉(何し損)so much loss

content.content: 死ねば死に損、生きれば生得
To die is so much lost; to live is so much gained.
打たれたら打たれ損だ
If you are beaten, you are so much the worse.
殺される者は殺され損さ
If any one is killed, he is so much the worse.
打った方は打ち得、打たれた方は打たれ損
One strikes with impunity; the other is struck without redress.

content:
そん〔村〕
〈名〉A village

content.content: 全村総出で水を防いだ
The whole village turned out in full force to fight the waters.
五カ村の名主
a headman of five villages
村長
a village headman

content:
そんえき〔損益〕
〈名〉Profit and loss; loss and gain; losses and gains

content.content: 損益を勘定する
to balance profit and loss
損益勘定
a profit and loss account
損益計算表
a statement of profit and loss
損益共分組合
a profit and loss association
損益相償う
The profits cover the losses.

content:
そんかい〔村会〕
〈名〉A village assembly

content.content: 村会議員
a member of the village assembly
村会議長
the president of the village assembly

content:
そんがい〔損害〕
〈名〉Loss; damage; injury:(死傷の意味なら)casualties

content.content: 損害を蒙る
to suffer a loss―sustain a loss
第一軍は重い損害を蒙った
The First Army lost heavily―suffered heavily.
敵に損害を与える
to inflict a loss on the enemy
大火でだいぶ損害があった
The fire did much damage―Much damage was done by the fire.
火災の損害
a loss from a fire―damages from a fire
十万円の損害
a loss of 100,000 yen―damages amounting to 100,000 yen
火災は十万円の損害を来たした
The fire caused a loss of 100,000 yen―caused damages amounting to 100,000 yen.
損害高
the amount of damage―the extent of damage
財産の損害高は十万円の見積り
The property loss is estimated at 100,000 yen―The damages are estimated at 100,000 yen.
暴風雨で損害があったか
Did the storm do any damage?―Was any damage done by the storm?
財産にだいぶ損害があった
Much damage was done to property.
暴風雨で船舶に多大の損害を与えた
The storm played havoc with the shipping.
汽船会社は五十万円の損害を蒙った
The Steamship Company has suffered a loss of 500,000 yen―suffered to the extent of 500,000 yen.
水害で非常な損害だ
The flood has done serious damage.
水害で線路はだいぶ損害を受けた
The railways are seriously damaged by the flood.
農家はこの水害でだいぶ損害を蒙っている
Farmers are suffering serious losses from the flood.
損害は会社で引受ける
The company holds itself responsible for all damages.
(請求し得べき)損害額
damages
損害額を一万円と見積る
The damages are laid at 10,000 yen.
損害を賠償する
to compensate one for damages―indemnify one for damages―make reparation for injury―make a restitution

content:
ぞんがい〔存外〕
〈副〉Contrary to expectation; beyond expectation; more... than one expected ［thought, hoped, feared］

content.content: 結果は存外だ
The result is unexpected―contrary to expectation―contrary to my expectations―not what I expected―surprising―a surprise.
彼の成功したのは存外だ
His success is unexpected―beyond expectation―beyond my expectations―an agreeable surprise.
仕事は存外骨が折れる
I find my work harder than I expected.
試験は存外やさしかった
The examination was easier than I had expected.
あそこの試験は存外やさしい
That examination is easier than people think.
君の病気は存外早く治った
You have recovered sooner than I expected―much sooner than I hoped.
彼の病気は存外長くかかった
His recovery has taken longer than I expected―much longer than I feared.
利益は存外多い
The profit exceeds my expectations―The profit is greater than I expected―far greater than I hoped.
損亡は存外少ない
The loss is less than I expected―much less than I feared.
存外好くできた
He has done it better than I expected―beyond my expectations―surprisingly well.
成績は存外好い
The result exceeds my expectations―The result is better than I expected―beyond my expectations―surprisingly good―an agreeable surprise.
成績は存外悪い
The result falls short of my expectations―does not come up to my expectations―The result is worse than I expected―disappointing―a disappointment.
存外好い天気になった
The weather has turned out to be an agreeable surprise.
今度の先生は存外駄目だ
The new teacher has fallen short of our expectations―He does not come up to our expectations―He is not so good a teacher as we expected.

content:
そんがいばいしょう〔損害賠償〕
〈名〉Compensation for damages; reparation for injury; restitution

content.content: 損害賠償をする
to compensate one for damages―make reparation for injury―make a restitution
損害賠償を請求する
to claim damages―demand damages
先方では十万円の損害賠償を請求する
The other party demands 100,000 yen damages―The other party has presented a claim for 100,000 yen―The other party lays the damages at 100,000 yen.
損害賠償の訴訟を起こす
to sue for damages―prosecute for damages
先方では損害賠償十万円の訴訟を提起した
They have brought an action for 100,000 yen damages―instituted a suit for 100,000 yen damages―filed a 100,000 yen suit against us.
損害賠償の訴訟
an action for damages

content:
そんがいようしょう〔損害要償〕
〈名〉A claim for damages; a demand for damages:(=する) to claim damages; to demand damages; to sue for damages; to prosecute for damages

content.content: 先方は十万円の損害要償を提起した
The other party has brought an action for 100,000 yen damages―instituted a suit for 100,000 yen damages―filed a 100,000 yen suit against us.
損害要償の訴訟
an action for damages

そんがっきゅう〔村学究〕
〈名〉A village oracle

content:
そんがん〔尊顔〕
〈名〉(Honorific for) your face

content.content: 麗しき尊顔を拝し恐悦に存じ奉る
I am rejoiced to behold your lordship in such excellent health.
久しく尊顔を拝さなかったね
I have not had the pleasure of seeing you for an age.

そんきょする〔蹲踞する〕
〈自動〉To crouch

そんきん〔損金〕
〈名〉Loss in money; pecuniary loss

content:
そんけい〔尊敬〕
〈名〉Respect; honour; reverence; veneration; esteem; deference; consideration:(=する) to respect (every man) ; to have a respect for (every man) ; to regard or treat (a man) with respect; to honour (one's parents) ; to reverence, revere, defer to (one's superiors) ; to venerate (an old man) ; to esteem (a scholar) ; to hold (a scholar) in esteem; to consider (a man highly, etc.)

content.content: 尊敬を払う
to pay respect to a man
彼の人格に対して相当の尊敬を払っている
I pay due respect to his personality.
彼は友人間に尊敬されている
He is respected by his friends―esteemed by his friends―highly considered by his friends.
長者を尊敬すべし
You should reverence your superiors―revere your superiors―defer to your superiors.
人彼を尊敬すること神の如し
People reverence him as a god.
父母を尊敬すべし
You should honour your parents.
老人を尊敬すべし
You should venerate old men―have a respect for age.
すべての人を尊敬すべし
You should respect every man―have a respect for every man.
人の個性を尊敬すべし
You should respect one's personality.
人の尊敬を受ける
to be respected―command respect―inspire respect (in others)
人に尊敬されるようにせよ
You must make yourself respected.
彼は徳が有るから尊敬される
He is honoured for his virtues―(他動詞構文にすれば)―His virtues make him honoured―His virtues command respect.
徳の有る人は尊敬される
Virtue commands respect.
彼は尊敬すべき人だ
He is an estimable man.
彼の性格は尊敬すべき性格だ
His character is worthy of respect.

content:
そんげん〔尊厳〕
〈名〉Dignity; majesty; sanctity

content.content: 皇室の尊厳を保つ
to maintain the Imperial majesty―maintain the dignity of the Throne
皇室の尊厳を冒す
to impair the dignity of the Throne
神仏の尊厳をけがす
to profane a temple―desecrate a shrine

content:
そんごう〔尊号〕
〈名〉An honorary title

content.content: 尊号を奉る
to give one an honorary title

content:
そんざい〔存在〕
〈名〉Existence; subsistence; being:(=する) to exist; to be in existence; to be existent; to be extant; to subsist; to be:(=せる) existing; existent; extant:(=せぬ) non-existent

content.content: 神の存在を論ずる必要があるか
Is there any need to discuss the existence of God?
霊魂の存在を証拠立てることができるか
Can one prove the existence of the soul?
こんな説が久しく前から存在していることを知らずにいた
Such a doctrine has long been in existence, without our knowing it.
日本は存在の為に戦った
Japan has fought for her existence.
存在の理由
raison d'?tre―reason for being―right to be
こんな人間は存在の理由が無い
There is no raison d'?tre for such men.
この制度の存在の理由はここに存す
Herein lies the raison d'?tre of the institution.
存在を主張する
to assert oneself
存在主張
self-assertion
存在を認める
to recognize one
彼はこの作によって著述家としての存在を認められた
This work won him recognition as an author.
神の存在を信ずるか
Do you believe in God?
存在物
a being

content:
ぞんざい
〈形〉
1. (=疎漏)careless; negligent; slovenly; slipshod; perfunctory

content.content: お前はぞんざいで困る
You are careless.
書き方がぞんざいだ
You write carelessly.
そうぞんざいに物を扱うものでない
You should not handle things so carelessly.
あの学校は教え方がぞんざいだ
The teaching is perfunctory―They teach in a perfunctory manner―at that school.
先生がぞんざいだ
The teachers are negligent of their duties.
あの人の文章はぞんざいだ
He writes a slovenly style―a slipshod style.
仕事をぞんざいにする
to slight one's work―fudge one's work―scamp one's work

content: 2. (=失礼)impolite; rude; rough

content.content: そんなぞんざいな言葉を使うものじゃない
You should not use such rude language.
お前は口の利きようがぞんざいだ
You have a rough way of talking.
人をぞんざいに扱う
to slight a man―neglect a man

content:
そんしつ〔損失〕
〈名〉Loss

content.content: 損失を蒙る
to suffer a loss―sustain a loss
損失を招く
to bring a loss on oneself
損失を来たす
to cause a loss
あのような人が死ぬのは国家の損失だ
He is a loss to his country.
彼の死は学界の損失だ
He is a loss to science.
損失額
the amount of loss

そんじもの〔損じ物〕
〈名〉Damaged goods

content:
ぞんじもよらぬ〔存じも寄らぬ〕
〈形〉→『

content.content: おもいもよらぬ〔思いも寄らぬ〕

そんじゃ〔尊者〕
〈名〉A Buddhist saint

content:
そんしょ〔損所〕
〈名〉An injured part; a damaged part; damage

content.content: 機械に損所を生じた
The machine is damaged.
損所を修繕する
to repair the damage
船の損所に仮修繕を施して回航することになっている
The ship is to be brought round after making temporary repairs to her damage.

そんしょう〔尊称〕
〈名〉A title; an honorary title

そんしょう〔損傷〕
〈名〉Injury; damage:(=する) to injure; to damage:(自動詞に用いれば)to be injured; to be damaged

そんじょう〔遜譲〕
〈名〉Modesty; humility

content:
そんしょく〔遜色〕
〈名〉Inferiority

content.content: 遜色有り
It is inferior to the other.
遜色無し
It can bear comparison with―stand comparison with―the other―It compares favourably with the other.
我が長門艦は何国の戦闘艦に比べても遜色が無い
The Nagato compares favourably with any battleship afloat.
日本の陸軍は欧米各国の陸軍に比して毫も遜色を見ず
The Japanese army can stand comparison with that of any western country.

ぞんじより〔存じ寄り〕
〈名〉A thought; an idea; an opinion

content:
そんじる〔損じる〕
〈自他動〉→『

content.content: そんずる〔損ずる〕

content:
そんする〔存する〕
〈自動〉
1. (=存在する)to exist; to be in existence; to be existent; to be extant

content.content: その実物はいまなお存す
The treasure is still in existence.
ローマ法王より伊達政宗に送りしラテン文の書はいまなお存している
The Latin epistle of the Pope of Rome to Date Masamune is still extant.
沙翁{しゃおう=シェークスピア}の生まれし家はいまなお存す
The house in which Shakespeare was born is still standing.

content: 2. (=何に存す)to lie (in something) ; to consist (in something)

content.content: 人の価値は財産に存せずしてその人格に存す
A man's dignity lies, not in what he has, but in what he is.
幸福は満足に存す
Happiness consists in contentment.
教育事業の困難は人選に存す
The difficulty of educational work lies in the choice of men.
彼は利益の存する所を知る
He knows where his interest lies―“knows on which side his bread is buttered.”
法文の趣旨実にここに存す
Herein lies the gist of the law.
若者の真意実にここに存す
Herein lies the true meaning of the author.
無限の妙味この一言に存す
An inexhaustible charm lies in this single word.

content: 3. (=残存する)to remain

content.content: なお存するは一人の息女
A daughter remains to him.

content: 〈他動〉(=保存する)to preserve

content.content: 原文の趣きを存して訳することは難い
It is difficult to translate so as to preserve the original beauty.

content:
そんする〔損する〕
〈自他動〉To lose

content.content: この取引で千円損した
I have lost 1,000 yen by the transaction―I am 1,000 yen out of pocket by the transaction.
損して得取れ
“Make the best of a bad bargain.”

content:
そんずる〔損ずる〕
〈他動〉To hurt; to injure; to impair; to damage; to destroy; to ruin

content.content: 身体を損ずる
to injure one's health―impair one's health
ひどく身体を損じている
He has ruined his health―He has a broken constitution.
人の威厳を損ずる
to impair one's dignity
人の名誉を損ずる
to injure one's reputation
人名を損ずる
to destroy life
酒ほど人命を損ずるものは無い
Alcohol is most destructive to human life.
人の感情を損ずる、ご機嫌を損じている
to hurt one's feelings―wound one's pride―offend one
彼は主人のご機嫌を損じている
He is in disgrace with his master―in his master's black books.
彼は今日はご機嫌を損じている
He is in ill humour―out of humour―today.

content: 〈自動〉To be injured; to be damaged; to get out of order; to go out of repair

content.content: 道具は手荒く扱ったために損じている
The furniture is damaged by rough usage.
機械が損じている
The machine is out of order.
家が損じている
The house is out of repair.
時計が損じている
My watch is out of order.
荷造りが悪いために品物が損じて来た
Owing to bad packing, the goods have arrived in bad condition.
夏は腹が損じやすい
The bowels easily get out of order in summer.
損じやすい品物
perishable goods―fragile articles

content:
ぞんずる〔存ずる〕
〈他動〉
1. (=知る)to know; to be aware of (a fact); to be acquainted with (a person)

content.content: それは存じませんでした
I did not know it―I was not aware of the fact.
そんなことはいっこうに存じません
I know nothing of the matter.
あの人をご存じですか
Do you know that man?
ちょいと存じております
I am slightly acquainted with him.
誰かそういう人をご存じありませんか
Do you know of any such person?
何かそういう本をご存じありませんか
Don't you know of any such book?
ご存じの通り家を焼きましたから
I had my house burnt down, you know.
ご存じの通り事が失敗に帰しましたから
The scheme has failed, as you know but too well.
あの学校にご存じの方がありますか
Do you know any one at that school?
ご存じの方があったらご紹介を願います
If you know any one, will you please introduce me to him?
ご存じより
From you know who.

content: 2. (=何を何と思う)to think (it a favour); to esteem (it an honour); to believe (it so); to feel (it so); to hope; to fear; to imagine

content.content: 身の光栄と存じます
I esteem it an honour―I appreciate the honour.
そうと存じます
I think so.
彼は洋行したように存じております
I believe he has been abroad.
成功するだろうと存じます
I hope he will succeed.
失敗だろうと存じます
I fear he will fail―I am afraid he will fail.
これは事実だろうと存じます
I think―feel―it is true.
さぞお悦びのことと存じます
I can imagine your joy.
此度は御卒業の由大慶に存じ候
Allow me to congratulate you on your graduation.

content:
そんそ〔樽俎〕
〈名〉A diplomatic conference; diplomatic negotiations

content.content: 樽俎の間に折衝する
to use diplomacy
彼は樽俎の間にて折衝して難関を切り抜けた
He surmounted the obstacle by diplomacy.
樽俎の間に折衝して偉勲を奏した
He highly distinguished himself by skilful diplomacy.

そんそう〔尊崇〕
〈名〉Reverence:(=する) to reverence, revere (one's superiors, etc.)

content:
そんぞく〔存続〕
〈名〉Continuance; endurance:(=する) to continue; to endure; to last

content.content: 砲の存続期
the life of a gun

content:
そんぞく〔尊属〕
〈名〉An ascendant; a lineal ascendant

content.content: 尊属親すら
one's ascendants―one's fathers

そんたい〔尊体〕
〈名〉The sacred body of the Emperor

content:
そんだい〔尊大〕
〈形〉Important; self-important; consequential; pompous

content.content: 尊大ぶる
to assume an air of importance-assume a consequential air―give oneself consequence―look big
彼は尊大にかまえている
He has a self-important air―a consequential air―a pompous air.
尊大ぶった人だ
He is a self-important man―a consequential man―a pompous man.
彼は尊大ぶってものをいう
He speaks with an air of importance―with a consequential air―with a pompous air.
あの人のいうことは尊大で癪に障る
His pompous talk displeases me.
彼は尊大ぶって僕らにものもいわぬ
He will not deign to speak to us―not condescend to speak to us―not vouchsafe to speak to us.
彼は少しも尊大ぶらぬ
He gives himself no consequence at all―He is quite condescending.

content:
そんたく〔忖度〕
〈名〉Conjecture; surmise:(=する) to conjecture; to surmise; to guess

content.content: これ己をもって人の心事を忖度するものである
That is judging of others by yourself.
英雄の心事は小人らの忖度し難きところである
A heroic mind is a sealed book to small men.

content:
そんちょう〔尊重〕
〈名〉Respect; esteem:(=する) to respect (the laws) ; to esteem (a scholar) ; to hold (learning) in esteem ; to value (honour above life) ; to set a value on (one's profession) ; to prize (liberty) ; to have a regard for (the laws) ; to consider (a person)

content.content: 国法を尊重せねばならぬ
We must respect the laws―have a regard for the laws.
彼は輿論を尊重せぬ
He has no regard for public opinion.
人の感情を尊重する
to have a regard for others' feelings
彼は人の感情を尊重せぬ(人の感情を害することをいう)
He has no regard for others' feelings.
人の個性を尊重する
to respect one's personality
真実を尊重する
to have a regard for truth
彼は真実を尊重せぬ(平気で嘘をつく)
He has no regard for truth.
学問を尊重する
to hold learning in esteem
我が国では学問を尊重する
Learning is held in high esteem in Japan.
肩書よりも実力を尊重するようになった
People have come to value ability above titles.
己が専門を尊重する
to set a value on one's profession
人はとかく己が専門を尊重し過ぎる
One is apt to set too high a value on―overrate―overestimate―one's profession.
彼は友人間に尊重されている
He is esteemed by his friends―highly considered by his friends.

content:
そんちょう〔尊長〕
〈名〉One's superiors

content.content: 尊長を敬え
Honour your superiors!

そんちょう〔村長〕
〈名〉A village headman

content:
そんとく〔損得〕
〈名〉Loss and gain; advantages and disadvantages; interest

content.content: 損得を差引く
to balance the gain against the loss
損得はどうでもよい
I don't care whether I gain or lose―I am not guided by interest.
彼はちゃんと損得を勘定している
He knows where his interest lies―“knows on which side his bread is buttered.”
この問題は損得を離れて考えなければならぬ
We must consider the question apart from interest.
多少の損得はしかたがない
Some advantages and disadvantages can not be helped.
人は性分によって損得がある
A man will gain or lose by his disposition―A man's disposition will make for or against him.
この取引は損得が無い
This is an even bargain.

content:
そんな
〈形〉Such; like that; that sort of; that kind of; of the kind

content.content: 僕はそんな本を読まない
I do not read such books―that sort of books.
そんな本を誰が読むものか
Who will read such a book?
そんな物はここに無い
We have no such thing―nothing of the kind.
本当の戦いはそんなものでない
A true battle is no such thing―nothing like that.
そんなことがあるものか
How can that be?
そんなはずは無い
That can not be.
彼はそんなことを言ったか
Did he say such a thing?
僕はそんなことを言ったかしら
I wonder if I can have said so.
そんなことを言うな
Don't talk like that!
彼は何でもそんな(意味の)ことを言った
He said something to that effect.
まあそんなものだ
That's about it―That's about the size of it.
僕はそんなばかなことはしない
I know better (than to do such a thing).
そんなことだろうと思った
I thought so―I thought as much.
そんなことじゃない
It is no such thing―nothing of the kind.
そんなことをするものか
I am damned if I do so―I am blest if I do so―Catch me (doing so)!

content:
そんなに
〈副〉So; so much

content.content: そんなに泣き騒ぐな
Don't take on so!
そんなに急ぐな
Don't be in such a hurry!
そんなにおかしいか
Are you so tickled?
そんなにうまくいこうとは思わなかった
I did not hope it would go so well.
そんなに金をどうする
What are you going to do with so much money?―all that money?
そんなに本が読めるか
Can you read so many books?―all those books?
そんなに金があったらたくさんだろう
You ought to be contented with so much money―all that money―all your wealth.

content:
そんなら
〈副〉If so; if that is the case; in that case; then

content.content: そんなら行こう
Then I will go.
そんならそうと言えばよいのに
Then, why didn't you say so?

ぞんねん〔存念〕
〈名〉A thought; an idea; an opinion

content:
そんのうじょうい〔尊皇攘夷〕
〈名〉Imperialism and exclusionism

content.content: その頃尊皇攘夷を盛んに唱えた
There was a cry of “Down with the Shogun and away with foreigners!”

content:
そんぱい〔存廃〕
〈名〉Maintenance or abolition; existence

content.content: 学校の存廃が今問題になっている
The very existence of the school is now the question.
存廃問題
the maintenance-or-abolition question

content:
そんぴ〔存否〕
〈名〉Existence (or non-existence)

content.content: もう神の存否を論ずる時ではない
The time for discussing the existence of God is past.

そんぷうし〔村夫子〕
〈名〉A village pedagogue

content:
ぞんぶん〔存分〕
〈名〉To one's heart's content

content.content: 折りがあったら存分腹いせをする
When I get a chance, I will wreak my grudge to my heart's content.
存分食う
to eat one's fill
存分飲ましてやれ
Let him drink his fill!
存分食って存分飲んだ
I have had my fill.
独りになってから存分泣いた
When I was left to myself, I cried my fill―had a good cry―had my cry out.
存分遊ぶと未練が残らぬ
Let a man have his fling, and he will not look back.
ご存分に願います
Deal with me as you think fit!

content:
そんぼう〔存亡〕
〈名〉Life or death; existence; fate

content.content: 存亡に関する問題だ
This is a question of life or death.
国家の存亡に関する
to involve the national existence―endanger the existence of the nation―The national existence is concerned―The natural existence is at stake
国家の存亡に関する戦争であった
The war involved the existence of the nation.
この戦争に国家の存亡を賭した
We staked the national existence on the war.
国家存亡の危機に迫った
The national existence was in imminent danger.
皇国の損増この一戦に在り
The fate of the Empire depends on this action.
国民として国家の存亡に利害関係を有せざるは無し
Every citizen has a stake in the country.
国家危急存亡の秋である
This is a national crisis―We are in a national crisis.
この危急存亡の秋に
in this crisis―in this exigency―in this emergency

content:
そんめい〔尊名〕
〈名〉Your (honoured) name

content.content: ご尊名はかねて承っておりました
I have known you by name.

content:
そんめい〔尊命〕
〈名〉Your orders; your wishes

content.content: 尊命に従い早速上京可仕候
I shall come up to town without delay in obedience to your wishes.

content:
ぞんめい〔存命〕
〈名〉Being alive:(=する) to be alive; to be living

content.content: ご両親はご存命ですか
Are your parents alive?―living?
まだ存命です
They are still living.
存命中
in life―in one's lifetime
存命中は慈善を道楽にした
In life, he delighted in acts of charity.
親の存命中に成功したいものだ
I should like to succeed in my father's lifetime―while my father lives.

content:
そんもう〔損耗〕
〈名〉Loss

content.content: 損耗を蒙る
to suffer a loss―sustain a loss

content:
そんらい〔尊来〕
〈名〉You coming; your presence; your company; your visit

content.content: 御尊来の程待上候
You will kindly favour us with your company―(旅館、料理屋などなら)―We beg you will honour us with your visit.

そんらく〔村落〕
〈名〉A village; a hamlet

content:
そんらん〔尊覧〕
〈名〉Your inspection

content.content: 書類を尊覧に供す
I submit the papers to your inspection.

content:
そんりつ〔存立〕
〈名〉Existence:(=する) to exist

content.content: 国家存立の本義は国民の幸福である
The state subsists for the welfare of the people.

content:
そんりつ〔村立〕
〈形〉Established by a village

content.content: 村立学校
a village school

そんりょ〔尊慮〕
〈名〉Your wish; your intention; your pleasure

content:
そんりょう〔損料〕
〈名〉Hire; rent

content.content: 損料で貸す
to let anything on hire―hire out anything―let anything for rent―rent anything
損料で借りる
to hire―rent―anything
礼服を損料で貸す所がある
Dress-suits are let on hire―They hire out dress-suits.
損料蒲団
hired bedding―rented bedding

content:
た〔他〕
〈形〉Other:(疑問詞や不定代名詞に後置すれば) else:(=に) besides

content.content: その他
the others―the rest―and others―and so forth―and so on―and the like―and such-like things
地理、歴史その他の学科は熟練を要さぬ
History, Geography, and the like,―and such-like branches,―require no practice.
他は推して知るべし
The rest may be inferred.
他の人々は残った
The other men―The others―remained behind.
その他には来た人は無いか
Did any other man come?―Did any one else come?
他に質問はありませんか
Have you any other questions?―Have you anything else to ask?
他に行く所はありません
I have no other place to go to―I have nowhere else to go.
その他誰が来るか
Who else are coming?
その他何か要るか
What else do you want?
彼はその他にも収入がある
He has some income besides―some other income.
他にも連累者がある見込み
Some others seem to be implicated in the affair.
語学に達するの道は他無し熟練の一あるのみ
There is no other way to master a language than practice―There is no way to master a language but practice―The only way to master a language is practice.

content:
た〔多〕
〈名〉Much

content.content: 多は言わず
He does not make many words about the matter―He is silent on the subject.
多とする
to appreciate―recognize
その光栄を多とす
I appreciate the honour.
その労を多とする
to recognize one's services
その労を多として昇級せしめた
He was promoted in recognition of his services.
あなたのような人のあるのは国家の為に多としなければならぬ
You are an honour to your country.

content:
た〔田〕
〈名〉A rice-field; a paddy-field

content.content: 田を作る、田を耕す
to cultivate the rice-fields―crop the rice-fields―place the rice-fields under crop
田が作ってある
The rice-fields are under crop―in crop.
百姓は田を耕す
The peasant tills the soil.
田を植える
to set out the rice-plants
田に水を引く
to irrigate the rice-fields―water the rice-fields
我が田に水を引く
to consult one's own interests―take care of No.1―“Every miller draws the water to his own mill”
田の畔
a raised foot-path between rice-fields

content:
だ〔駄〕
〈名〉A horse-load

content.content: 米一駄、米二駄
a horse-load of rice―two horse-loads of rice

content: 〈形〉Inferior; poor; sorry; wretched

content.content: 駄作だ
It is sorry stuff―wretched stuff.
駄評だ
It is poor criticism.

content:
たあい〔他愛〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: あいた〔愛他〕

content:
たあいない〔たあい無い〕
〈形〉→『

content.content: たわいない

content:
たい〔他意〕
〈名〉(Not) any other intention; (not) any malice or ill-will or offence

content.content: 彼の非を挙げるのはただご注意のためで決して他意あるわけではない
In mentioning his faults, I have no other intention than that of warning you.
こう言って他意無きことを示した
I said so to show that I bore him no malice―I said so to show that I meant no offence.

content:
たい〔体〕
〈名〉
1. (=身体)the body

content.content: 体を交わす
to dodge

content: 2. (=方式)a style

content.content: 書の体
a style of penmanship

content:
たい〔対〕
〈名〉
1. (=反対)the opposite

content.content: 黒は白の対
Black is the opposite of white.

content: 2. (=対等)equal footing; equal terms

content.content: 対で碁を打つ
to play “go” on equal terms―without giving or taking odds

content: 〈前置詞相当〉Against; towards; with; versus(vs.―と略す)

content.content: 数は一百対七十五
The numbers are 100 against 75.
慶応対早稲田野球試合
a Keio versus Waseda baseball match
田中対伊藤の訴訟事件
The case of Tanaka versus Ito
(競技の得点は)三対二の勝
The scores are 3 to 2 in our favour.
三対二の負け
The scores are 3 to 2 against us.
三対二の得点で勝った
We won by a score of 3 to 2.
議案は二百票対百五十票の多数で通過した
The bill passed by a majority of 200 votes to 150.
対米策
policy towards America―American policy
対米関係
relations with America―American relations
対外政策
foreign policy

content:
たい〔帯〕
〈名〉A zone

content.content: 熱帯
the torrid zone
寒帯
the frigid zone
温帯
the temperate zone

content:
たい〔隊〕
〈名〉A body (of men); a party (of travellers); a company (of foot); a troop (of children); a band (of patriots); a corps (of engineers); a force

content.content: 隊を組む
to form a body
隊を組んで押しかけた
We went in a body.
隊を解く
to disband a corps
一隊の兵を率いて
at the head of a body of men
ロシアでは強盗が白昼隊を成して横行した
In Russia, robbers stalked the streets in bands in broad daylight.
捜索隊
a search-party
遠征隊
an expeditionary force
飛行隊
a flying corps
鉄道隊
a railway corps

content:
たい〔鯛〕
〈名〉The sea-bream

content.content: 海老で鯛を釣る
to throw a sprat to catch a whale
腐っても鯛
He is none the less a samurai―none the less a gentleman―none the worse for his age―“It is not in gold to be oxydized.”

content:
たい〔度い〕
〈接尾動詞〉I wish (to do something); I want (to do something); I choose to (do something); I am desirous (to do something); I am eager (to do something); I am impatient (to do something); I am anxious (to do something); I am curious (to see or to hear); I am dying (to see her); I should like (to do something); I feel like (doing something)

content.content: 僕は洋行したい
I wish to go abroad―want to go abroad.
洋行したいものだ
I should like to go abroad.
君も行きたいか
Do you wish to go?―Should you like to go?
あの地位が得たい
I wish to get the position―I am desirous to secure the position.
行きたいから行く
I go, because I choose to go.
来たいから来る
I come, because I choose to come.
早く行きたい
I am eager to go―I am impatient to be gone.
試験の成績が早く聞きたい
I am anxious to know the result of my examination.
その男に会ってみたいものだ
I am curious to see the man.
その話を聞いてみたいものだ
I am curious to hear the story.
彼にぜひ会いたい
I am dying to see him.
国の便りが早く聞きたい
I dying for news from home.
明日来て貰いたい
I wish you to come―want you to come―tomorrow.
髪を刈って貰いたい
I want to have my hair cut.
顔を剃って貰いたい
I want to get shaved.
明日はどうか天気にしたいものだが
I wish it would be fine weather tomorrow.
お前も今度はどうか及第さしたいものだが
I wish you would pass this time.
僕も行きたかった
I wish I had been there―I should like to have been there.
観艦式が見たかった
I wish I could have seen the naval review―I should like to have seen the naval review.
その演説が聞きたかった
I wish I could have heard the speech―I should like to have heard the speech.
彼に会いたかった
I wish I could have seen him―I should like to have seen him.
二人は会いたかったろう
They would have liked to have seen each other.
泣きたいような気がする
I feel like crying.

content:
だい〔代〕
〈名〉
1. (=代々の代)a generation

content.content: 彼は三代目だ
He is a descendant of the third generation―the third in descent.
家光は徳川三代の将軍
Iemitsu was the third Shogun of the Tokugawa family.
三代に仕えた老臣だった
He was an old servant who had served three generations.
猫を殺せば七代祟る
One who kills a cat will be cursed to the seventh generation―“A cat has nine lives.”
不正の富は三代続かぬ
Ill-gotten wealth seldom descends to the third generation.
代々
for generations―generation after generation―from father to son

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: あの店は代が変わった
The establishment has changed hands.
代が変わってから繁昌しなくなった
It has fallen in prosperity after changing hands.

content: 2. (=人の一代)an age; a lifetime

content.content: 人は一代名は末代
A man lives only for an age, but his name may live to all ages―Man is mortal, but fame is immortal.
一世一代の作だ
It is the greatest work of his life.

content: 3. (=誰の代)(one's) lifetime, time, reign

content.content: 親の代には繁昌した家だ
The house flourished in his father's time.
何天皇の代に
In whose reign?
彼は三代に仕えた
He saw three reigns.

content: 4. (=代価)the price (of an article)

content.content: 代はいくらか
What is the price?―How much?―What do you ask for it?
品物の代を払う
to pay for an article
この洋服はまだ代が払ってない
This coat is not yet paid for.
代は見てのお戻り
“The proof of the pudding is in the eating.”

content: 5. (=代理)a deputy; a proxy

だい〔台〕
〈名〉
1. (=物を乗せる台)a stand, a rest, a rack, a support, a stage, a platform (for something); a mounting (for a stuffed bird); a setting (for a gem); a pedestal (for a statue); a horse (for clothes); a block (for a wig); a pier (for a bridge)

content.content: 立像には台がついている
The statue stands on a pedestal.
機械は台に乗っている
The machine is on a stand.
剥製した鳥に台をつける
to mount a stuffed bird
金剛石は白金台だ
The diamond is set in platinum.
台つきの像
a mounted statue
(大工などの)仕事台
a bench―a table

content: 2. (=物価の台)

content.content: 何円台
so many yen level or line

content: 2. (=概して)generally; nearly always; most of the time

content: 3. (=殆ど、おおよそ)nearly; about; almost; much (the same)

content.content: 彼にはたいがい毎日会う
I see him nearly every day.

content: 4. (=多分)probably; most likely; ten to one; I think; I hope; I fear; I am afraid

content.content: 明日はたいがい着くだろう

I thought as much.

content: 5. (=程に)moderately; in moderation; reasonably; in reason; within bounds

content.content: たいていたいがいにしろ
Be moderate!―Use moderation!―Keep within bounds!―“The last drop makes the cup run over.”
あまり慾張らないでたいがいのところで我慢してはどうか

ばかもたいがいにしろ
Do not carry your folly too far!―You carry your folly to excess.
冗談もたいがいにしろ
You carry your joke too far―That is carrying a joke too far―There are limits to a man's patience.

content:
〈形〉
1. (=大切な)important, momentous, weighty, grave, serious (matter); precious, beloved, dear (child); valuable (things); valued, prized, esteemed (treasure); treasured (blade); particular (business)

content.content: これは大事な役目だ
This is an important duty.

It is important that a student should have this fact impressed on his mind.

ちと大事な用があって伺いました
I have called on particular business.

He is a valued friend to me―I set a high value on his friendship―I set store by his friendship.
これは僕の身にとっては命から二番目というほど大事なことだ
The matter lies near my heart―next my heart.
大事な金を取られた

親が大事だ

身体が大事だ
Health demands care―One must be careful of one's health.
身体は何より大事だ

大事にする
to take good care of―be careful of―attend to―make much of―think much of―set store by―cherish―a person or thing
娘をくれてやるから大事にしろ
You must take good care of her―make much of her.
身体を大事にしろ

勤めを大事にする

学生は何はさておき学問を大事にすべし
A student should, before everything, attend to his studies.
彼女は主人を大事にする
She is faithful in her master's service.
彼は部下を大事にする
He treats his subordinates kindly.
親を大事にする
to make one's parents comfortable
女房を大事にする
to make one's wife happy
夫を大事にする
to love one's husband
兄弟を大事にする
to cherish one's brother
人を兄弟のように大事にする
to cherish one as a brother
彼は人を大事にし過ぎる
He kills people with kindness.
彼女は写真を肌身離さず大事にしている
She wears his photograph next her skin.
一人娘を荒い風にも当てないようにして大事にした
He kept his only daughter as the apple of his eye.
彼は我が家へ帰って大事にされている
He is in the bosom of his family.
大事にしてしまっておきなさい
Keep the treasure under lock and key.
大事を取る
to use prudence―to be prudent―on the safe side
大事を取るに越したことは無い
It is best to be on the safe side.

This is a Herculean task.

content:
たいした〔大した〕
〈形〉
1. Great; immense; enormous; magnificent; splendid; capital; superb; glorious; tremendous; stupendous; amazing; astounding; wonderful; prodigious; phenomenal; stunning; spanking; ripping; rattling; thundering

content.content: 大臣になりゃ大したものだ
It would be a great thing to be a cabinet minister.
あれで国へ帰りゃ大したものだ
He will be a great man at home.
彼は大した身代だ
He has an immense fortune―an enormous fortune.
米国の財源は大したものだ
America has enormous resources―tremendous resources―stupendous resources.
大した学者だ
He is a prodigious scholar.
大した美人だ
She is a stunning beauty.
彼は大した家に住んでいる
He lives in a splendid house―a magnificent house―a palace of a house.
大した身形{みなり}だ
He is superbly dressed―He looks swell.
今度の芝居は大した当たりだ
The new play is an amazing success―an astounding success―a phenomenal success.
大したご馳走だった
It was a splendid dinner―a capital dinner―a rattling dinner―a stunning spread―a spanking spread―a ripping spread―a thundering spread.
こりゃ大した代物だ
It is a stunner―a spanker―a rattler―a ripper―a scorcher―a screamer―a smasher―a whopper.
(人を評して)大したものだ
He is a wonderful man―What a man!
大した人出だ
There is an immense crowd―What a crowd!
大した本だ
What a lot of books!
大した身代だ
What a fortune!
大した金だ
What a sight of money!
大した雨だ
What a downpour!
大した水だ
What a flood!
大した火だ
What a conflagration!

content: 2. (打消に伴えば) (no) great; (not) much; (nothing) serious

content.content: 彼は大した学者じゃない
He is no great scholar―not much of a scholar.
大した降りにもなるまい
It won't be much of a rain.
大した吹きにもなるまい
It won't be much of a blow.
大したご馳走でもなかった
It was not much of a dinner―not much of a spread.
大した相違は無い
There is no great difference.
彼は大したものにはならぬ
He will not amount to much―not come to much.
彼は大した財産は無い
He has no property to speak of.
大した著述は無い
He has written nothing to speak of.
大したことではない
It is nothing serious―of no consequence―no matter.
君の病気は大したことじゃあるまいね
Your illness is nothing serious, I hope?
損は大したことじゃない
The loss is of no consequence.
彼が来なくても大したことは無い
His absence is no matter―His absence does not matter―His absence matters little.
空模様は悪いが大したことはあるまい
The sky looks lowering, but it won't be much of a storm.
次の議会は大したことはあるまい
The next session will not be much of a storm.

content:
たいして〔対して〕
〈前置詞相当〉
1. (=人や物に対して)(形容詞に続けば) to (one):(名詞に続けば) to, towards (one):(動詞に続けば) towards (one):(ある動詞には) by (one); with (one)

content.content: 西洋人は婦人に対してていねいだ
Foreigners are polite to the ladies.
長者に対してていねいにせよ
Be respectful to your superiors―Behave respectfully towards your superiors.
彼は敵に対して立派な処置をした
He has acted nobly towards his enemy.
あの人は部下に対して愛情が有る
He shows a partiality towards his subordinates.
国家に対して義務を尽さねばならぬ
I must do my duty to my country.
友人に対して義理を立てなければならぬ
I must do my duty by my friend.
彼は子どもらに対して好くする
He does well by his children.
彼は友人に対してやり方が酷だ
He deals harshly by his friends.
すべての人に対して正直にせよ
Deal honestly with all men!―Be honest with all men!
すべての人に対して公平にせよ
Deal justly with all men!―Be just to all men!
彼は子どもに対して厳格だ
He is severe with his children.
日本は米国に対して戦争を仕かける気は無い
Japan has no mind to make war on America.

content: 2. (=数に対して) against; to; per

content.content: 否とする者百五十に対して可とする者二百
There are 200 ayes against 150 noes.
百五十に対して二百の多数
a majority of 200 to 150
入学志願者は昨年の一千に対して今年は千五百有る
There are 1,500 applicants this year against 1,000 of last year.
得点は二に対して三の勝ち
The scores are 3 to 2 in our favour.
死亡率は千人に対して十八人
The death-rate is 18 per 1,000.

content: 3. (=反対して) as opposed to; in opposition to; in contradistinction to

literary style as opposed to―in opposition to―colloquial style
怠慢罪に対して普通の罪を違法罪という
We speak of sins of commission in contradistinction to sins of omission.

content.content: 彼は大して学問はできない
He is no great scholar―not much of a scholar.

大して吹きもすまい

あの人の成功するのは大して不思議は無い

大して興味のある学科じゃない

この品は大して高くもない

彼の今度の作は大して立派なものじゃない

大して偉い人じゃない

大して偉い人とも思われぬ

大して立派な家でもない

大して寒くもない

大して辛くもない

〈形〉All right; well; safe; secure

content.content: 大丈夫、己がついている
All right! I am at your back.
君がついていさえすりゃ大丈夫
All is well, so long as I have you at my back.
事件は彼にまかしておけば大丈夫だ

この砲台は攻撃を受けても大丈夫だ
The fort is secure against attack.
何百人来ても大丈夫だ
We are secure against hundreds―We are more than a match for hundreds.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 病人はもう大丈夫だ
The invalid is out of danger.
大丈夫と信頼する
to rely upon one's promise―depend upon the truth of one's statement―count upon one―confide in one
君はきっと来るか、大丈夫か
May I count upon you?
大丈夫(金の脇差)
You may rely upon me―Never fear!
君の言うことは大丈夫本当か
May I depend upon the truth of your statement?―Are you sure?
大丈夫(金の脇差)
You may depend upon it.
この土瓶は火にかけても大丈夫か
May I put the tea-pot over the fire?
どんなに手荒く扱っても大丈夫だ
It will stand any rough handling.

content: 〈副〉Certainly; undoubtedly; assuredly

content:

content.content: 西洋人は婦人に対して丁寧だ
Foreigners are polite to the ladies.
長者に対して丁寧にせよ
Be respectful to your superiors!―Behave respectfully towards your superiors!

He is severe with his children.
家名を落とさないようにするのが君の先祖に対する義務だ

友人に対して義理を立てなければならぬ
I must do my duty by my friend.

〈名〉The substance (of a speech); the sum and substance (of a case); the general outline (of a plan):(=の) general

content.content: 彼の言ったことの大体はこんなものだ
That is the sum and substance of his statement.
事件の大体を述べておこう
I will state the substance of the case.
だいたいにおいて僕は君と同意だ

a general idea

計画の大体を説こう
I will give you a general idea of my scheme.
だいたいの筋はこんなものだ
That is a general outline of my plan.
大体から見れば事は成功している
On the whole,―Taken altogether,―the thing is a success.

content: 〈副〉In substance; on the whole; in the main; taken altogether

content.content: 大体左の如くに御座候
It is, in substance, as follows:―
だいたいこれは間違っている
On the whole, this is wrong.
君がだいたい間違っている
You are altogether wrong.

content.content: 強健な態度をとる

日本は列国と対等である

人と対等になる

これで二人は対等になる(貸借が無くなる、あいこになる)

content:
たいへん〔大変〕
〈名〉A serious matter; a great calamity; an alarming state of things; an awkward state of things; an embarrassing turn of affairs

content.content: そいつは大変だ
That's a serious matter―That's serious.
(何事か―What is the matter?―と問われて)大変です
A great deal is the matter―All is lost!―The game is up!
そりゃ大変
Heavens!―Good Heavens!―Great Heavens!―Death!
あの人間の手にかかったら大変だ
It would be death to fall into his hands.
さあ大変だ
What will become of us?
そりゃ大変だ
Here is an alarming state of things―Here is an awkward state of things―Here is an embarrassing turn of affairs―Here's a go!―Here's a nice go!―Here's a pretty go!―Here's a rum go!―What a go!
(あれよりおしゃべりじゃ)それや大変だ
That's saying a great deal.
(千円)そりゃ大変だ
That's a great deal.
(免職)それり大変だ
That's a calamity.
君の身にもしものことがあったら大変だ
What if anything should happen to you!
日本が負けたら大変だ
What if Japan should be defeated!
日本が負けたら大変だった
If Japan had been defeated, it would have gone hard with us―What would have become of us if Japan had been defeated?
一歩踏み違えると大変だ
A single false step would be fatal.
一足滑ったら大変だ
A slip, and all is over.
やり損なったら大変だ
A miss, and all is up.
見つかったら大変だ
If I am discovered, I am undone.
悟られたら大変だ
If we are suspected, there will be a row―there will be a scene.
親父に知れたら大変だ
If it comes to my father's ears, I shall get into a row.

content:
〈形〉
1. (=な) (=大した、容易ならぬ) great; immense; enormous; serious; alarming

content.content: そいつは大変なことだ
That's a serious matter.
大変なことになった
The matter grows serious.
こりゃ大変なことだ
Here is an alarming state of things―Here's a go!―Here's a pretty go!―Here's a rum go!―What a go!
大変な騒ぎだ
There is a hell of a noise.
(医者を呼びにやるやら)大変な騒ぎだ
There is much ado―They are making a great fuss.
かかりが大変だ
The expenses are heavy.
大変な金がかかる
It costs an enormous sum of money―a sight of money.
大変な手数だ
It costs immense trouble―a world of trouble.
米国の財源は大変なものだ
America has immense resources.

content: 2. (=な) (=すてきな、すばらしい) magnificent; splendid; superb; grand; glorious; tremendous; stupendous; awful; amazing; astounding; prodigious; phenomenal; stunning; spanking; rattling; ripping; thundering

content.content: 彼は大変な家に住んでいる
He lives in a splendid house―a magnificent house―a palace of a house.
大変な身なりをしている
He is superbly dressed―What a swell he is!
大変な学者だ
He is a prodigious scholar.
大変な美人だ
She is a stunning beauty―What a beauty!
世間は大変な景気だ
The times are glorious.
米国の財源は大変なものだ
America has enormous resources―tremendous resources―stupendous resources.
今度の芝居は大変な当たりだ
The new play is an amazing success―an astounding success―a phenomenal success.
大変なご馳走だった
It was a splendid dinner―a stunning spread―a rattling spread―a spanking spread―a ripping spread―a thundering spread.
こりゃ大変な代物だ
It is a stunner―a spanker―a rattler―a ripper―a scorcher―a screamer―a smasher―a whopper.
大変な人出だ
There is an immense crowed―What a crowd!
大変な本だ
What a lot of books!
大変な身代だ
What a fortune!
大変な雨だ
What a downpour!
大変な金だ
What a sight of money!
大変な水だ
What a flood!
大変な火だ
What a conflagration!

content: 〈副〉(=に) (=たいそう、非常、滅法) awfully; immensely; extremely; exceedingly; stunning; rattling; spanking; ripping; thundering

大変に寒い

大変面白かった

大変手数がかかる
It costs a world of trouble.
大変金がかかる
It costs a lot of money―costs a sight of money.

content:
たいめん〔体面〕
〈名〉
1. (=面目)honour

content.content: 国家の体面を汚す
to dishonour one's country―disgrace one's country―reflect (discredit) on one's country
海外に在る時は国家の体面に関するようなことをするな
When you are abroad, abstain from such actions as will reflect on your country.
あれは国家の体面を汚す奴だ

お前は一家の体面を汚す奴だ

Do not disgrace Japanese manhood!―Do not bring disgrace on Japanese manhood!
あのような生徒があると学校の体面に関する

そんなことをしては紳士の体面に関する
Such conduct would be beneath the dignity of a gentleman―beneath a gentleman.
借金を返さなくては紳士の体面に関する
It is a point of honour with me to pay my debts―I make a point of paying my debts.

content: 2. (=体裁)appearances

content.content: 体面を繕う

A cabinet minister must keep up appearances befitting his position.

There is constant traffic―continual traffic―continuous traffic―in this street.
昨日から絶えず降っている
It has been raining without intermission―without a break―without a lull―since yesterday.
彼は絶えずしゃべっている
He is continually talking―He is talking incessantly―He talks without cessation―He talks nineteen to the dozen―He is talking all the time.
砲弾が絶えずヒューヒューと空をかすめた
Shells whistled past without intermission.
彼とは絶えず文通している
We carry on constant correspondence.
彼は絶えず奔走している
He is continually on the move―ever on the move.
世には絶えず争いがある
There is incessant strife―everlasting strife―in the world―Man will never cease from strife.
二人は絶えず言い争っている
They are perpetually bickering―There are perpetual bickerings―incessant bickerings―between the two.
英語は絶えず練習しないと下手になる
You must practise English constantly, or you get out of practice.
彼は絶えず熱心に職務に従事している
He attends to his duties with unremitting zeal.
車が絶えずまわっている
The wheel turns incessantly―unceasingly―ceaselessly―without cessation.
我々は絶えず新しいことを学ぶ
We are always learning something new―We learn something new at every step.
御地の商況を絶えずお知らせ下さい
Please keep me advised of the state of your market.

content:
たえだえ〔絶え絶え〕
〈叙述形容詞〉(To be) all but exhausted, faint, broken

content.content: 息も絶え絶えになっていた
I found him at his last gasp.
息も絶え絶えに助けてと叫んだ
“Help! help!” he cried, gasping for breath.
声も絶え絶えに物語った
He told his story in a faint voice.
交通も絶え絶えになった
Correspondence is interrupted.

content:
たえて〔絶えて〕
〈副〉Never

content.content: その後は絶えて会いません
I have never seen him since.
近頃は絶えて会いません
I have seen nothing of him of late.
其後は絶えて御無音に打過ぎ申候
You will not be offended with me for not writing sooner.
絶えて久しく
not... for a long time
絶えて久しくお目にかかりません
I have not seen you for an age.
絶えて久しく彼の消息が無い
Nothing has been heard of him for a long time.

content:
たえはてる〔絶え果てる〕
〈自動〉To become exhausted; to become extinct

content.content: 絶え果てた動物がいくらもある
Many animals are extinct.
息が絶え果てていた
Not a spark of life remained.

content:
たえま〔絶間〕
〈名〉Intermission; interruption; cessation; an interval (of business); a break (in the row); a lull (in the storm); a rift (in the clouds)

content.content: 雲の絶え間から日が射す
The sun shines through a rift in the clouds―The sun breaks through the clouds.
あの家には波瀾の絶え間が無い
The family is subject to constant troubles.
この町は人通りの絶え間が無い
There is no interruption of traffic―constant traffic―a constant stream of traffic―in this street.
今朝から客の絶え間が無かった
We have had a constant stream of visitors since morning.

たえまなき〔絶間無き〕
〈形〉Constant (stream); continual (motion); continuous (row); incessant (labour); unceasing (industry); unremitting (attention); uninterrupted (prosperity); perpetual (quarrelling); everlasting (strife, etc.)

content:
たえまなく〔絶間無く〕
〈副〉Constantly; continually; continuously; incessantly; unceasingly; ceaselessly; without cessation; perpetually; unremittingly; uninterruptedly; without interruption; without intermission; without a break; without a lull

content.content: 昨日から絶え間無く降っている
It has been raining without intermission―without a break―without a lull―since yesterday.
彼は絶え間無く食っている
He is constantly eating.
彼女は絶え間無くしゃべっている
She is continually talking―She is talking incessantly―She talks without cessation―She talks all the time.―She talks nineteen to the dozen.
彼とは絶え間無く文通している
We carry on constant correspondence.
彼は絶え間無く働いている
He is constantly at work―continually at work―incessantly at work.
あの家は朝から晩まで入り代り立ち代り絶え間無く客来がある
They have a constant succession of company―an unceasing stream of visitors―from morning till night.

content:
たえる〔堪える、耐える〕
〈他動〉
1. (=忍ぶ、我慢する、こらえる)to endure, bear, stand (pain); to tolerate, suffer (one's insolence); to put up with, make shift with (poor fare); to be patient of (control); to contain oneself

content.content: 艱難辛苦に堪える
to endure hardships and privations
この暑さには堪えられぬ
I can't stand the heat―The heat is unbearable―unendurable―beyond endurance―past bearing―not to be borne.
あの男の生意気は堪えられぬ
I can not tolerate―can not suffer―his impertinence―His impertinence is intolerable―insufferable.
さすがの僕もこの苦しさには堪え得なかった
I could not stand the strain―The strain was too much for me.
若い者は束縛を堪え得ない
Young people can not bear restraint―The young are impatient of restraint.
血の通う人間には堪えられぬ艱難だ
The hardships are more than flesh and blood can bear.
おかしさに堪え切れなくなってとうとう吹き出した
I could not contain myself and burst out laughing.
腹が立って堪え切れずとうとう彼を殴った
I could not stand the provocation and struck him―I was provoked into striking him.
堪え得る(苦しさなど)
endurable―bearable―strain→『たえがたい〔堪え難い〕』→『たえかねる〔堪え兼ねる〕』

content: 2. (=支える、もちこたえる)to bear (the burden); to stand (the strain); to withstand (an attack); to support (fatigue); to hold out (a siege); to be proof against (fire or water)

content.content: 人民がこの負担に堪えるか
Can the people bear the burden?
彼の身体はよく疲労に堪える
His constitution supports fatigue wonderfully well.
そんな長い戦争には国力が堪えぬ
The resources of the country can not stand the strain of such a long war―Such a long war will be too great a strain on the country's resources.
日本の海軍は実戦の試験に堪えた
The Japanese navy has stood the test of actual warfare.
生兵は砲火に堪えぬ
Raw recruits can not stand fire.
敵は我が軍の攻撃に堪えずして退却した
The enemy, unable to withstand our attacks, retreated―The enemy retreated before our attacks.
木造の橋は列車の重量に堪えぬ
A wooden bridge can not bear the running load of a train.
彼の財産はその費用に堪える
His fortune can stand the expense―He can afford the expense.
要塞は長い籠城に堪えぬ
The fortress can not hold out a long siege.
火に耐える
to be proof against fire―fireproof
水に耐える
to be proof against water―waterproof
地震に耐える
to be proof against earthquakes―earthquake-proof
誘惑に堪える人は少ない
Few people are proof against temptation―Few people can resist temptation.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 不幸に堪える
to bear up under misfortune―hold up under misfortune―have fortitude under misfortune
船が暴風に堪える
A ship rides out a gale―weathers a gale.
彼は身体が強壮なために長患に堪えた
His strong constitution carried him through his long illness.

content: 3. (=任に堪える、使用に堪える)to be equal to (the task); to be competent to (the task); to be fit for (service); to be good for (service)

content.content: 任に堪える
to be equal to the task―competent to the task
彼は任に堪えぬ
He is unequal to the task―(現職に堪えぬの意味なら)―He is sinking under his burden.
あの偉人はいかなる難局にも堪える
The great man is equal to any occasion―He will rise to the occasion―rise superior to the occasion.
彼はどんな職にも堪える
He is capable of filling any post.
彼は年が行き過ぎているからこの職には堪えぬ
He is too old for the post.
彼は老朽用に堪えず
He is old and unfit for service―too old for service.
彼は老耄劇務に堪えぬ
He is in his dotage, and unfit for a busy office.
この重任に堪える人があるか
Is any one fit for this responsible post?
(君は病後で)旅行に堪えるか
Are you equal to the journey?
彼は病気上がりで歩行に堪えぬ
He has just recovered from an illness, and can not walk.
この船はまだ任務に堪える
The ship is still fit for service.
この船は古くて使用に堪えぬ
The ship is old and unfit for service―too old for service.
この家はまだ使用に堪える
The house is still fit for use.
この馬は五年間の使用に堪える
The horse is good for five years' service.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 船は航海に堪える、航海に堪えぬ
The ship is seaworthy―unseaworthy.
六カ月の航海に堪える
She can keep the sea for six months.
たえず〔堪えず〕

content:
たえる〔堪える、耐える〕
〈他動〉
1. (=忍ぶ、我慢する、こらえる)to endure, bear, stand (pain); to tolerate, suffer (one's insolence); to put up with, make shift with (poor fare); to be patient of (control); to contain oneself

content.content: 艱難辛苦に堪える
to endure hardships and privations
この暑さには堪えられぬ
I can't stand the heat―The heat is unbearable―unendurable―beyond endurance―past bearing―not to be borne.
あの男の生意気は堪えられぬ
I can not tolerate―can not suffer―his impertinence―His impertinence is intolerable―insufferable.
さすがの僕もこの苦しさには堪え得なかった
I could not stand the strain―The strain was too much for me.
若い者は束縛を堪え得ない
Young people can not bear restraint―The young are impatient of restraint.
血の通う人間には堪えられぬ艱難だ
