おかしさに堪え切れなくなってとうとう吹き出した
I could not contain myself and burst out laughing.
腹が立って堪え切れずとうとう彼を殴った
I could not stand the provocation and struck him―I was provoked into striking him.
堪え得る(苦しさなど)
endurable―bearable―strain→『たえがたい〔堪え難い〕』→『たえかねる〔堪え兼ねる〕』

content: 2. (=支える、もちこたえる)to bear (the burden); to stand (the strain); to withstand (an attack); to support (fatigue); to hold out (a siege); to be proof against (fire or water)

content.content: 人民がこの負担に堪えるか
Can the people bear the burden?
彼の身体はよく疲労に堪える
His constitution supports fatigue wonderfully well.
そんな長い戦争には国力が堪えぬ
The resources of the country can not stand the strain of such a long war―Such a long war will be too great a strain on the country's resources.
日本の海軍は実戦の試験に堪えた
The Japanese navy has stood the test of actual warfare.
生兵は砲火に堪えぬ
Raw recruits can not stand fire.
敵は我が軍の攻撃に堪えずして退却した
The enemy, unable to withstand our attacks, retreated―The enemy retreated before our attacks.
木造の橋は列車の重量に堪えぬ
A wooden bridge can not bear the running load of a train.
彼の財産はその費用に堪える
His fortune can stand the expense―He can afford the expense.
要塞は長い籠城に堪えぬ
The fortress can not hold out a long siege.
火に耐える
to be proof against fire―fireproof
水に耐える
to be proof against water―waterproof
地震に耐える
to be proof against earthquakes―earthquake-proof
誘惑に堪える人は少ない
Few people are proof against temptation―Few people can resist temptation.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 不幸に堪える
to bear up under misfortune―hold up under misfortune―have fortitude under misfortune
船が暴風に堪える
A ship rides out a gale―weathers a gale.
彼は身体が強壮なために長患に堪えた
His strong constitution carried him through his long illness.

content: 3. (=任に堪える、使用に堪える)to be equal to (the task); to be competent to (the task); to be fit for (service); to be good for (service)

content.content: 任に堪える
to be equal to the task―competent to the task
彼は任に堪えぬ
He is unequal to the task―(現職に堪えぬの意味なら)―He is sinking under his burden.
あの偉人はいかなる難局にも堪える
The great man is equal to any occasion―He will rise to the occasion―rise superior to the occasion.
彼はどんな職にも堪える
He is capable of filling any post.
彼は年が行き過ぎているからこの職には堪えぬ
He is too old for the post.
彼は老朽用に堪えず
He is old and unfit for service―too old for service.
彼は老耄劇務に堪えぬ
He is in his dotage, and unfit for a busy office.
この重任に堪える人があるか
Is any one fit for this responsible post?
(君は病後で)旅行に堪えるか
Are you equal to the journey?
彼は病気上がりで歩行に堪えぬ
He has just recovered from an illness, and can not walk.
この船はまだ任務に堪える
The ship is still fit for service.
この船は古くて使用に堪えぬ
The ship is old and unfit for service―too old for service.
この家はまだ使用に堪える
The house is still fit for use.
この馬は五年間の使用に堪える
The horse is good for five years' service.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 船は航海に堪える、航海に堪えぬ
The ship is seaworthy―unseaworthy.
六カ月の航海に堪える
She can keep the sea for six months.
たえず〔堪えず〕

content:
たえる〔絶える〕
〈自動〉
1. To become extinct; to die out; to run out; to fail; to cease; to end; to come to an end; to be cut off

content.content: 血筋(血統)が絶えた
The family is extinct―The family has died out.
アイヌ人は今に絶える(死に絶える)
The Ainos are dying out―becoming extinct.
種が絶えた
The seed has run out.
水が絶える
Water fails.
交通が絶える
Communication is cut off―Traffic is interrupted.
供給が絶える
The supply is cut off.
交通が絶えた
Our correspondence has ceased―come to an end.
話が絶える
The talk dies.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 彼とは久しく音信が絶えている
I have not heard from him for a long time.
望みが絶える
One's hopes go to the ground.
もう望みがすっかり絶えた
My hopes are dashed to the ground―My hopes are blighted―My hopes are blasted―I am in despair.
成功の望みが絶えた
I despair of success.
全快の望みが絶えた
His recovery is despaired of―There is no hope of his recovery―He is past hope of recovery―It is all over with the invalid―It is all up with the invalid―He is a gone case.
息が絶える
to expire―breathe one's last
行って見ると息が絶えるところであった
I found him at his last gasp.
父が死んで学資の道が絶えた
My father's death stopped my supply of school-expenses.
十時には行人の跡が絶える
At ten o'clock, the streets are deserted.
道に行人の跡が絶えた
The streets were deserted―Not a soul was to be seen in the streets.
この島へ行くと人跡が絶える
There is no trace of man―no sign of human habitation―in this island.
絶えぬ
to be constant―continual―continuous―incessant―perpetual―everlasting
あの学校は悶着が絶えぬ
There are constant troubles in that school.
あの家は波瀾が絶えぬ
The family is subject to constant troubles.
国内騒乱絶えず
The country is subject to constant disturbances.
あの先生は生徒ともめ事が絶えぬ
He has constant troubles with his students.
泉岳寺は参詣人が絶えぬ
The Sengakuji is constantly visited by worshippers.
年中苦情が絶えぬ
There are constant troubles from year's end to year's end.
人は苦労が絶えぬ
Man is subject to constant troubles―never free from trouble.
彼の門は車馬の出入りが絶えぬ
His door is constantly besieged by callers.
行人の跡が絶えぬ
The traffic is continuous.
この町は人通りが絶えぬ
There is constant traffic―continual traffic―continuous traffic―in this street.
世に争いは絶えぬ
There is incessant strife―everlasting strife―in the world―Man will never cease from strife.
二人の間に言い争いが絶えぬ
There are incessant bickerings―perpetual bickerings―between the two.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 水が絶えぬ
Water never fails.
彼とはまだ文通が絶えぬ
I still correspond with him.
頂上には年中雪が絶えぬ
There is snow at the summit all the year round.
年中心配が絶えぬ
I am never free from care.
身に故障絶えず
He is always in some trouble or other―(身体の故障なら)―He is never quite well.
あの人は悪い噂が絶えぬ
He is always giving rise to some scandal or other.
たえざる〔絶えざる〕
たえず〔絶えず〕

content:
だえんけい〔楕円形〕
〈名〉An ellipse; an oval:(=の) elliptic(al); oval

content.content: 楕円軌道
an elliptic orbit

content:
たおす〔倒す〕
〈他動〉
1. (=倒れさす) to bring down, throw down (anything standing); to throw (a man) to the ground; to fell (a tree); to lay, lodge (corn, etc.)

content.content: 地震のために多くの家が倒された
The earthquake has brought down―destroyed―many houses.
暴風のために多くの木が吹き倒された
The gale has blown down many trees.
雨や風のために稲が倒された
The rain has laid the rice-plants―The wind has lodged the rice-plants.
人を張り倒す
to knock a man down

content: 2. (=殺す) to kill

content.content: 人を倒す
to kill a man
鹿を倒す
to fetch a deer

content: 3. (=亡ぼす) to ruin; to overthrow

content.content: 薩長が幕府を倒した
The two feudatories overthrew the Shogunate.
内閣を倒す
to unseat the Cabinet

content: 4. (=負かす) to defeat; to beat

content.content: あの力士は横綱を倒さんとする意気込みだ
He is bent on beating the champion-wrestler.

content: 5. (=踏み倒す) to bilk

content.content: あの男に百円倒された
He has bilked me out of 100 yen.

たおやめ〔手弱女〕
〈名〉A graceful maiden

content:
たおる〔手折る〕
〈他動〉To break off (a branch); to pluck (a flower)

content.content: 桜の枝を手折るべからず
It is not allowed to break off the cherry branches.
花を手折る
(両意義において)to pluck a flower
蕾の花を手折る
to pluck a flower in the bud
枝手折る人にも匂う梅の花(に相当するは)
“The tree does not withdraw its shade from the wood-cutter.”
枝手折る
To him who plucks thy bloom
人にも匂う
Thou grudgest not, O plum!
梅の花
Thy sweet perfume.
手折らじな人の
The plum-tree's blossoms I will spare
垣根の梅の花
That grace my neighbour's wall;
我にてしりぬ
By mine own heart I knew how dear
人の心を
They must be to his soul.

content:
たおれ〔倒れ〕
〈名〉
1. (=滅亡) ruin

content.content: 京都の着倒れ
The Kyoto people ruin themselves by extravagance in dress.
東京の食い倒れ
The Tokyo people ruin themselves by extravagance in food.
入費倒れになる
The profits do not cover the expenses―“The game is not worth the candle”

content: 2. (=取れない貸金) a bad debt

content.content: 貸金の倒れが出る
Some debts prove bad.

content:
たおれる〔倒れる〕
〈自動〉
1. (物なら) to fall; to come down:(人や動物なら) to fall; to drop; to go over; to roll over; to sink to the ground; to measure one's length on the ground:(力尽きてなら) to give out

content.content: 家が倒れる
A house falls―(自分の入っている家なら)―A house comes down about one's ears
地震で多くの家が倒れた
Many houses came down in the earthquake―Many houses were destroyed by the earthquake―(他動詞構文にすれば)―The earthquake brought down―threw down―destroyed―many houses.
地震後に行ってみると多くの家が倒れておった
When I went there after the earthquake, I saw many fallen houses.
家はすさまじい音がして倒れた
The house fell with a crash.
この柱一本あるために家が倒れない
This post Keeps the house from falling.
建物が倒れかけている
The building is ready to fall―nodding to its fall―tottering to its fall.
倒れんとする家
a falling house
倒れた家
a fallen house
風で木が倒れた
The wind has blown down trees.
道路に木が倒れておった
There was a fallen tree on the road.
雨や風で麦が倒れた
The rain has laid the corn―The wind has lodged the corn.
人が倒れると弥次馬が来て踏み付ける
“If a man once fall, all will tread upon him”
団結すれば立ち分離すれば倒る
“United, we stand; divided, we fall.”
力尽きて倒れた
His strength failed him, and he sank to the ground―(途中でなら)―He gave out on the way.
入学する者は多くあっても途中で倒れる者が多い
Many enter, but most of them give out on the way.
手桶を下げたまま倒れた
Over he went with his pail of water.
野牛が胸に弾を受けてドウと倒れた
The buffalo, hit in the breast, rolled over.
何条もって堪るべきズデンドウと打ち倒れた
Unable to stand the shock, he measured his length on the ground.
兵がバタバタと倒れた
The men were dropping on every side―Man after man fell.
酔って倒れる
to drink oneself dead drunk―drink oneself to sleep
彼は酔って倒れている
He is dead drunk―(西洋では)―He is under the table.
酔払いが路傍に倒れている
A drunkard is lying by the roadside.
彼は熱病で倒れている
He is down with a fever.
血煙立てて倒れた
He fell weltering in blood.
血汐の海に倒れていた
He was weltering in a pool of blood―wallowing in his blood.
将棋倒しに倒れた
They went down like ninepins.
腹がへって倒れそうだ
I am faint with hunger.
吹けば倒れそうだ
One might knock him down with a feather.
大厦の倒れんとするや一木のよく支うる処にあらず
When a great house is about to fall, no single post can prevent it―(意訳すれば)―No man can stay single-handed a falling empire.
重荷に堪えずして倒れる
to sink under a burden
不幸に逢って倒れる
to sink under misfortune―succumb under calamities
不幸に逢っても倒れぬ
to hold up under misfortune―bear up under misfortune
皆倒れるまで戦った
They all fell fighting.

content: 2. (=亡びる) to fall; to be overthrown; to be ruined; to go to ruin; to collapse:(商家なら) to fail; to become bankrupt

content.content: 銀行が倒れると多くの人が迷惑する
If a bank fails, many people are involved in the loss.
あの会社は倒れかけている
The firm is on the brink of ruin―on the eve of bankruptcy.
不景気の為に泡沫会社が続々倒れる
Owing to the commercial depression, bubble companies collapse in rapid succession.
内閣が倒れる
A cabinet falls.
内閣が倒れかけている
The Cabinet is on the point of falling―nodding to its fall―tottering to its fall.
倒れんとする政府
a tottering government
慶応の末に幕府が倒れた
The Shogunate was overthrown at the end of the Keio era.
幕府の倒れた跡に明治政府が立った
The Meiji government rose on the ruins of the Shogunate.
僕は学校と共に倒れる決心だ
I am determined to share the fortunes of the school.
学校と共に倒れる決心の人はいくらもある
Many people identify themselves with the school.

content:
たおれる〔斃れる〕
〈自動〉To die (of a disease); to succumb (to a disease); to fall (beneath the sword); to fall a prey (to an epidemic); to fall a victim (to an assassin); to die a martyr (to science); to perish (by the sword); to be carried off (by cholera, etc.)

content.content: 病に斃れる
to die of a disease―succumb to a disease―fall a prey to an epidemic―be carried off by an epidemic
肺病で斃れる者は少なくなった
Few people now succumb to consumption.
Pericles は黒死病で斃れた
Pericles fell a prey to the plague.
コレラで斃れた者が何千人
Thousands fell preys to cholera―Thousands were carried off by cholera―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Cholera carried off thousands.
この病にかかると十中八九は斃れる
Nine cases out of ten prove fatal.
刺客の毒手にかかって斃れる
to fall a victim to (the dagger of) an assassin
Lincoln は主義の為に斃れた
Lincoln died a martyr to his cause.
刀にかかって斃れる
to fall beneath the sword―perish by the sword
敵兵の多くが日本兵の銃槍にかかって斃れた
Many Russians fell beneath the Japanese bayonet.
斃れるまで働く
to die in harness
肺病にかかる者は斃れるまで働く覚悟でいるがよい
People suffering from consumption should be prepared to die in harness.
斃れて後止む決心だ
I am determined to do or die.

たおんじ〔多音字〕
〈名〉A polyphone

content:
たか〔高〕
〈名〉An amount; a sum

content.content: 高は何ぼどになるか
What does it amount to?
金高
a sum of money―an amount of money
〆高
the sum total
預かり高
the sum deposited
上がり高
the profits
売上げ高
the proceeds of a sale
たかが
at best―only
たかが教員だ
He is, at best, but a teacher―He is a mere teacher.
たかが百円だ
It is only a hundred yen.

content:
たか〔多寡〕
〈名〉
1. A quantity; an amount

content.content: 多寡に応じて、多寡によって
in proportion to the amount
損害の多寡に応じて金を分配する
The money will be distributed among the sufferers in proportion to the damage suffered.
多寡の知れた
trifling―inconsiderable
東京の冬は寒いといっても多寡の知れたものだ
The cold in Tokyo is trifling―not worth considering.
この商売はいくら儲かっても多寡が知れている
The profits of the business are but a trifle―nothing to speak of.
たかが
at best―only
彼はたかが教員だ
He is, at best, but a teacher―He is a mere teacher.
たかが百円だ
It is only 100 yen.
多寡をくくる
to minimize―underrate―make light of―make nothing of―think nothing of―anything
これしきの病気と多寡をくくっていた
I made light of my illness.
相手が小国と多寡をくくったのがそもそもの間違いだ
They made a mistake, in the first place, in underrating their enemy.
こんなことは多寡をくくっています
I make nothing of―think nothing of―the matter.
金の話かなにかだろうと多寡をくくっていた
I thought of the matter as something to do with money.

content:
たか〔鷹〕
〈名〉The hawk; the falcon

content.content: 鷹が雀をさらう(に相当するは)
A hawk pounces upon a chicken.
鷹につかまれた雀のよう
He is a chicken in the hawk's talons.
鳶が鷹を生む
“A black hen lays white eggs.”
能ある鷹は爪を隠す(に相当するは)
“Still waters run deep.”
欲張る鷹は爪が抜ける
“Grasp all, lose all.”
鷹は飢えても穂を摘まず(に相当するは)
“An eagle will not catch flies.”
鵜の目鷹の目で捜す
to seek with eager eyes
顔のあらを鵜の目鷹の目で捜す
to scrutinize one's face
鷹狩り
hawking―falconry
鷹匠
a hawker―a falconer

content:
たが〔箍〕
〈名〉A hoop

content.content: たがを掛ける
to put hoops on a tub―bind a tub with hoops―hoop a tub
たが掛け
a hooper―a cooper
たがをはずす
to take the hoops off a tub―unhoop a tub
彼はたがをはずして騒いでいる
He is on the spree.
たががはずれる
A hoop comes off.
たががはじける
A hoop springs (off the tub).
たががゆるむ
A hoop gets loose.
彼はたががゆるんだ
He has lost his energy.
金たが
a metal hoop

content:
だが
〈接続詞〉But

content.content: 彼は学者は学者だが教師には向かぬ
He is a good scholar, to be sure, but he won't do for a teacher.
だがしかし学者は無いものだ
But yet good scholars are rarely to be met with.

content:
たかい〔高い〕
〈形〉
1. (=低いに対し)high; lofty; tall; raised

content.content: 高い山
a high mountain
山高きが故に貴からず木あるを以て貴しとす
A mountain is valuable, not because it is high, but because it is wooded.
高い塔
a high tower―a lofty tower
高い木
a high tree―a tall tree
高い木は風当たり強い
The higher the tree, the stronger the wind.
西洋人は背が高い
Foreigners are tall.
君は僕より五寸高い
You are taller than I by six inches―You are six inches taller than I.
君はだんだん背が高くなる
You are growing taller and taller―You are shooting up.
高い所
a height
高い所から落ちる
to fall from a height
あの人は鼻が高い
He has a high nose.(転意は特例を見よ)
鼻が高過ぎる
His nose is too prominent.
波が高い
The sea is running high―A high sea is running.
日はまだ高い
The sun is still high.
彼は位か高い
He is high in rank.
地位が高い
He holds a high position.
身分が高い
He is of a high social position.
望みが高い
He aims high―looks high.
高い望みを懐いている
He has high aspirations―(からつまらぬものには目を付けぬ)―He flies at higher game.
見識が高い
He has high views―lofty views.
人格の高い人だ
He is a man of high character―of lofty character.
学動がお高い
He has a lofty demeanour.
あの学校は程度が高い
The school is of a high grade.
程度の高い学校
a high-grade school
この学校の英語は程度が高い
The English of this school is of a high standard.
低きより高きに登る
to rise―climb―mount
高きに登るは低きよりす
“He who would climb the ladder must begin at the bottom.”

content:
2. 
〈以下特例〉

content.content: 君は成功して鼻が高い
You ought to be proud―may well be proud―of your success.
彼は息子が偉くなったから鼻を高くしている
He is proud of his son's greatness.
息子が偉くなると親父の鼻が高い
The father may be proud of his son's greatness―The son's greatness reflects credit on his father.
彼は鼻を高くして帰って来た
He returned with conscious pride―with a triumphant look―in triumph.
お目が高い
You are a good judge―You are a connoisseur―You have appreciation.
見物は目が高い
The audience are appreciative.
生徒は目が高い
The students are good judges of their teachers.
あの男は頭が高い
He is proud―haughty.
頭が高い(!)
Lower your head!―Bow your head!―Humble yourself!―(西洋ふうに言えば)―Down on your knees!
聞こえが高い
to be noted―famed―famous―renowned―celebrated
賢明の聞こえ高し
He is renowned for his wisdom.
気品が高い
to be noble―dignified―elevated―elegant―refined―delicate―chaste―graceful
気品の高い風采だ
He has a noble air―a dignified air―a graceful air.
あの人はどことなく気品が高い
There is a high moral tone about him―something noble and dignified about him.
あの人の嗜好は気品が高い
He has refined tastes―He is a man of refined tastes.
気品の高い作
a refined work
気品の高い模様
chaste design
気品の高い文章
a dignified style―an elevated style
あの男は高く止まっている
He is stuck-up.
枕を高うして寝る
to sleep in peace―sleep on a calm conscience
国民は枕を高うして寝られる
The people can now sleep in peace.
悪事を為す者は枕を高うして寝られぬ
Those who do evil can not sleep on a calm conscience.

content: 3. (=声が高い) loud; high

content.content: あの人は声が高い
He has a loud voice.
声が高い(!)
Hush!
高い声で話す
He talks in a loud voice.
調子が高い
The pitch is (too) high.
調子の高い声
a high-pitched voice―a shrill voice

content: 4. (=値が高い)dear; high in price; costly; expensive

content.content: 値が高い、価が高い
The price is high.
品物が高い
The article is dear―high in price―costly―expensive.
物価が高い
The prices are high.
諸式が高い
The commodities are dear―high in price.
米が高い
Rice is dear.
米の相場が高い
Rice is high in price.
米が高くなった
Rice has risen (in price).
生活費が高い
The cost of living is high―Living is dear.
家賃が高い
The house-rents are high.
日本橋は場所だから家賃も地代も従って高い
Nihonbashi is a business centre, and the rents are accordingly high.
これは高い薬だ
This is a costly medicine.
これは高い本だ
This is an expensive book.
この馬は三百円じゃ高い
The horse is dear at 300 yen.
この酒は一升二円じゃ高い
This wine is dear at two yen a sho.
その半分でも高い
It would be dear at half the price.
この品はいくら高くとも千円はしまい
The article can not cost 1,000 yen at most―at the highest―at the outside.
善い物はいくら高くとも安いものだ
A good thing is cheap at any price.
悪い物はいくら安くとも高いものだ
A bad thing is dear at any price.
只ほど高いものは無い
The highest price you can pay for a thing is to ask for it.
高く買う
to buy dear―make a bad bargain
人を高く買う
to overrate a man
本物ならいくら高くとも買う
I will buy a genuine article at any price―I will give any price for a genuine article.
高く売る
to sell dear―sell at a high price―sell at a high figure
安く買って高く売る
They buy cheap and sell dear.
お前は高いことを言う
You charge too high―ask too much.
車屋が高いことを言う
The rickshaman asks a big fare.
車屋が足元を見て高いことを言う
The man, taking advantage of the traveller's fatigued condition, asks an exorbitant fare.
売り手は高いことを言ってなかなか負けない
The sellers stand firm.
この品は高くつく
The goods come high.
高いものにつく
to cost one dear
下手な経済はかえって高いものにつく
Unwise economy may cost one dear―One may pay dear for a little economy.
自動車を抱えると高いものにつく
It is expensive to keep a motor-car.
高く踏む
to estimate anything high
高く踏んでも百万はあるまい
He can not be worth a million, at most―at the highest estimate.

たかい〔他界〕
〈名〉The other world:(=する) to go to the other world; to die

content:
たがい〔互〕
〈名〉
1. (=相互関係)mutual relation; reciprocal relation; reciprocity:(=の) mutual; reciprocal:(=に) mutually; reciprocally:(二人なら)each other:(三人以上なら) one another

content.content: 二人は互いに相愛す
They love each other―Each of them loves the other.
人は互いに相い助け合うべきものだ
People should help one another.
お互いに力になろう
Let us stand by each other!
二人は互いに悪口を言い合っている
They abuse each other.
互いに利益を図る
to consult mutual interests―play into each other's hands
お互いの便利を図ってそうきめた
It was so decided for mutual convenience.
その方がお互いの利益だ
That will be to our mutual advantage.
彼と僕とはお互いに義理がある
We are under mutual obligations.
(甲は乙を助け乙は甲に従うというように)互いに義務を尽す
to discharge reciprocal duties
二人は互いに敬礼をした
They bowed to each other―exchanged bows.
七色が互いに入り交じる
The colours of the rainbow blend with each other.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: (世話になるのは)お互い様(だから礼を言うには及ばないなど)
“One good turn deserves another.”
(そちらがその手で来るならこちらもその手で行く)お互い様
“Two can play at that game.”
ご無沙汰はお互いだ
The neglect is on both sides.

content: 2. (=君と僕)you and I; we

content.content: お互いそうしようじゃないか
Let you and I do so! ［注意］文法上 “Let you and me” と言うべきをかく言う習慣なり。
お互いの間で何も遠慮することはない
Let there be no reserve between us!

content: 3. (=各)each

content.content: 互いに勝手なことばかり言っている
Each consults his own convenience.

content:
たがいせん〔互先〕
〈名〉Alternately putting down the first stone (at the game of go); an equal match

content.content: 二人は互い先だ
They are equally matched.

content:
たがいちがいに〔互違いに〕
〈副〉Alternately

content.content: 白と黒を互い違いに置く
to alternate black and white
黒と白が互い違いになっている
Black alternates with white.

content:
たかいびき〔高鼾〕
〈名〉A loud snore

content.content: 高鼾をかく
to snore loudly
あの人は雷のような高鼾をかく
He snores like thunder.
君の部屋まで聞こえるようではずいぶん高鼾をかいたろう
I must have snored loudly indeed, to be heard in your room.
彼は高鼾で寝ておった
He was asleep with a loud snore.

content:
たがう〔違う〕
〈自動〉
1. (=ちがう)to differ (from something); to be different (from something)

content.content: 寸分違わず
without the least difference―exactly
寸分違わず原作を写した
The original was exactly copied.
これは寸分違わぬ原作の写しだ
This is an exact copy of the original.
寸分違わずお指図通りに致しました
I have obeyed your instructions to the letter.
彼は八時というと一分も違わずにやって来る
He appears at eight to the minute.
弾は狙い違わず命中した
The shot, true to its aim, hit the mark.
事志と違う
Things do not go as I wish―Things go wrong with me.

content: 2. (=違背する)to break (one's promise); to break, go back upon (one's word); to break, infringe, violate, transgress, offend against, trespass against (the law); to be contrary to (reason); to be against (reason); to go against (one's principles); to sin against (morality); to act against (orders); to run counter to (orders); to depart from (the rule); to deviate from (a course); to err from, stray from, wander from, swerve from (the path of duty, etc.)

content.content: 約に違う
to break one's promise―break one's word―go back upon one's word
掟に違う
to break the law―violate the law―infringe the law―offend against the law
そんなことをしては掟に違う
That would be against the law―contrary to the laws.
道に違う
to err from the path of duty―deviate from the path of virtue
道理に違う
to be against reason―contrary to reason
そんなことをしては道徳に違う
It would be against morality―contrary to the laws of morality―You would sin against morality.
復讐は人倫に違う
Revenge is against morality.
人倫に違う行動
an immoral action
命に違う
to act against orders―run counter to orders
これより進んでは命令に違う
To advance farther would run counter to orders.
この金を取っては主義に違う
It would go against my principles to take this money.
そんなことをしては良心に違う
It would go against my conscience to do so.
人情に違うことはできぬ
One can not go against human nature.
礼に違う
to sin against propriety
そんなことをしては礼に違う
That would be against the laws of propriety―You would sin against propriety.
自然は法に違わず
Nature never deviates from her course.
規則に違う
to be against (all) rule
そんなことをしては校則に違う
That would be contrary to the school regulations.
結果は所期に違う
The result is contrary to my expectations.

たかうきぼり〔高浮彫〕
〈名〉High relief; alto-relievo

content:
たがえる〔違える〕
〈他動〉To break (one's promise); to violate (a treaty, etc.)

content.content: 約を違える
to break one's promise
言を違える
to break one's word―go back upon one's word
僕はきっと言を違えない
I will keep my word.
彼は言を違えずに(来た、金を出したなど)
He was true to his word―as good as his word.
彼はいつも時間を違えない、一分も違えない
He is always punctual―punctual to the minute.

content:
たかが〔高が〕
〈副〉At best; only; merely

content.content: たかが先生だ
He is, at best, but a teacher―He is a mere teacher.
たかが百円だ
It is only 100 yen.

content:
たかがり〔鷹狩〕
〈名〉Hawking; falconry

content.content: 鷹狩りに行く
to go hawking
王は鷹狩りをしておった
The king was out hawking.

content:
たかく〔多額〕
〈名〉
1. A large sum; a large amount

content.content: 多額の金
a large sum of money―a large amount of money
多額の資金を要する
It requires a large capital.
多額の資金を要するをもって計画は中止になった
The plan has been abandoned owing to the large capital needed for its execution.
多額納税者
the highest tax-payers
多額納税議員
a highest-tax-paying member of the House of Peers

content:
たがく〔多額〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: たかく〔多額〕

content:
たかくとまる〔高くとまる〕
〈自動〉To to stuck-up

content.content: 彼は高くとまって僕らの処へ顔出しもしない
He will not condescend to call on me.

content:
たかごえ〔高声〕
〈名〉A loud voice:(=で) in a loud voice; loudly

content.content: 高声を立てる
to utter a loud voice―(怒ってなら)―break out into violent language
高声で話す
to talk in a loud voice
高声で人を呼ぶ
to hail a man

content:
たかさ〔高さ〕
〈名〉
1. Height; altitude; elevation

content.content: あの山は高さがとのくらいあるか
what is the height of that mountain?―How high is that mountain?
あの山の高さは五千尺有る
The mountain is 5,000 feet high―It measures 5,000 feet in height―It has a height of 5,000 feet.
富士山は高さ一万二千尺以上ある
Mt. Fuji rises to a height of over 12,000 feet.
この木は高さが三十間くらいになる
This tree grows to a height of about 180 feet.
飛行機が三千尺の高さを飛んでおった
The aeroplane was flying at a height of―at an altitude of―3,000 feet.

content:
2. (=声の高さ)loudness
3. (=調子の高さ)pitch

たかさご〔高砂〕
〈固名〉(The poetical name for) Formosa

content.content: 高砂の爺さんと婆さん
Darby and Joan.

だがし〔駄菓子〕
〈名〉Coarse confectionary; seed-cake

たかしお〔高潮〕
〈名〉A tidal wave

たかじょう〔鷹匠〕
〈名〉A hawker; a falconer

content:
だかせる〔抱かせる〕
〈他動〉

content.content: 牝鶏に卵を抱かせる
to set a hen on eggs―set a hen―set eggs

content:
たかだい〔高台〕
〈名〉An eminence; a hill; high ground

content.content: その家は高台で市中を見下ろしている
The house stands on an eminence looking down over the city.

content:
たかだか〔高々〕
〈副〉At the highest; at most; at the outside

content.content: 彼の財産はたかだか十万円くらいのものだろう
He can't be worth more than 100,000 yen, at most.

content:
たかだかと〔高々と〕
〈副〉High; aloft; loudly

content.content: 高々と差し上げる
to hold anything aloft
声高々と詩を吟ずる
to recite a poem in a loud voice

content:
だかつ〔蛇蝎〕
〈名〉Snakes and scorpions

content.content: 人を蛇蝎のように嫌う
to detest―loathe―a person

content:
たかっけい〔多角形〕
〈名〉A polygon:(=の) polygonal

content.content: 正多角形
a regular polygon

content:
だかつしする〔蛇蝎視する〕
〈他動〉To detest, loathe (a person)

content.content: 二人は互いに蛇蝎視している
They hate each other like poison.

content:
たかてこてにしばる〔高手小手に縛る〕
〈熟語〉To bind one's hands behind one's back

content.content: 犯人は高手小手に縛られた
The culprit had his hands bound behind his back.

たかとび〔高跳び〕
〈名〉High jump:(=する) to jump high

content:
たかとび〔高飛び〕
〈名〉Abscondence:(=する) to abscond; to fly from justice

content.content: 犯人は高飛びした
The culprit fled from justice.
朝鮮へ高飛びした
He fled to Korea.

たかどま〔高土間〕
〈名〉A raised floor (in the auditorium of a theatre)

たかなみ〔高波〕
〈名〉A high sea; mountain waves

content:
たかね〔高根〕
〈名〉Heights

content.content: 高根の花と諦める
She is beyond my reach.
富士の高根
the heights of Fuji

content:
たかね〔高値〕
〈名〉A high price

content.content: 高値を吹く
to ask an unreasonable price
めっぽうな高値だ
It is an exorbitant price―a prohibitive price.
市場は高値を唱えている
The market rules high.
この品は高値を唱えている
These goods are quoted high.

たがね〔鏨〕
〈名〉A burin; a graver; a chisel

たかばなし〔高話し〕
〈名〉A loud talk:(=する) to talk in a loud voice

content.content: これは家の宝として永く保存致します
I will keep it as a household treasure.

A good wife is a household treasure.

この正宗は僕にとっては宝の持ち腐れだ
The Masamune blade is or no earthly use to me.

content:
だから
〈接続詞〉As; because; since; seeing that; now that

content.content: 病気だから学校を休む
As I am ill, I will not go to school.
僕は貧乏だからそんなぜいたくはできない
I can not afford such extravagance, because I am poor.
西洋人だから大目に見ておく
Since he is a foreigner, I will make allowances.
彼は未丁年だから酒も煙草も飲めぬ
He can not drink or smoke, seeing that he is a minor.
もう丁年だから酒も煙草も飲める
Now that he is of age, he may drink and smoke.

content: 〈副〉(=それだから)so; and so; so that; therefore; that is why

content.content: 昨日は病気だった、だから学校を休んだ
I was ill yesterday, so I did not go to school.
彼は金持ちだ、だから勉強しないのだ
He is rich, and so he does not work.
彼は丈夫だ、だから働ける
He is strong, so he can work―(他動詞構文にすれば)―His strength enables him to work.
僕は貧乏だからそんなぜいたくはできない
I am so poor that I can not afford such extravagance―I am too poor to afford such extravagance.
彼は国賊だから殺した
He was a traitor, therefore I slew him.
だから承知しないのだ
That's why I can't agree.
だから言わないことじゃない
Why, I've told you many times.

content: 〈副〉(Not) therefore

You are rich, it is true; but you must not therefore be idle.

〈他動〉

content.content: 火を焚く
to make a blazing fire―light a fire―kindle a fire
職人は火を焚いている(焚き火している)
The workmen have a blazing fire.
火を焚いて当たっている
They are warming themselves at the blazing fire.
篝火{かがりび}を焚く
to light a bonfire
薪を焚く
to burn wood
石炭を焚く
to burn coal
(船中で)石炭焚きをする
to stoke
石炭焚き
a stoker
風呂に何をお焚きになりますか
What do you burn under your bath-tub?
香を焚く
to burn incense
沈香も焚かず屁も放らず
He never made mistakes and never made anything―He has no merits or faults.
護摩を焚く
to make a fire-offering
焚く物を焚き尽した
We have burnt up the fuel―run out of the fuel.
(寒いから)ストーブを焚け
Make a fire in the stove―Light the stove.
この温かいのにストーブを焚いているのか
You have a fire in the stove―have a fire up―in this warm weather.
風呂を焚きましょうか
Shall I get the bath ready?―heat the bath?
風呂がおぬるいなら焚きましょう
If the bath is not hot enough, I will put more wood on the fire.

content.content: 女が子どもを抱いている
She has a child in her arms.
子どもを抱いて立っている
She is standing with a child in her arms.
一日子どもを抱いて歩く
She carries a child in her arms all day.
子どもが母に抱かれている
The child is in its mother's arms.
子どもが母に抱かれたいと言う
The child wants to come into its mother's arms.
負ぶうといえば抱かれるという
“Give him an inch, and he will take an ell.”
負ぶった子より抱いた子
“Close sits my shirt, but closer sits my skin.”
人の子を抱く
to hold a baby
あかちゃんを抱かして下さい
Let me hold your baby!―Give me your baby to hold!
女を抱く(抱いて寝る)
to sleep with a woman―lie with a woman
石地蔵を抱いて寝たようだった
I slept with an iceberg.
女が男に抱かれる
She is in his embraces.
牝鶏が卵を抱く
A hen sits on eggs―sits―broods―incubates.
牝鶏に卵を抱かせる
to set a hen on eggs―set a hen―set eggs

content.content: 彼は卓越した学者だ
He is a prominent scholar―an eminent scholar.
学者として卓越している
He is preeminent for his scholarship―He is by far the best of all scholars.
学識が卓越している
He excels in scholarship―He possesses excellent scholarship.
学識衆に卓越している
He surpasses other scholars in scholarship.

content:
たくさん〔沢山〕
〈名〉(多数、多量)a great number, great numbers (of books); a large quantity, large quantities (of wine); plenty (of money); an abundance (of food); a lot, lots (of books); a heap, heaps (of money); a store (of wisdom):(=の) many, a great many, a good many (books); much, a great deal of, a good deal of (money); plentiful (supply); abundant (food)

content.content: 日本には英語のできる人は沢山ある
There are many Japanese―a great many Japanese―a good many Japanese―great numbers of Japanese―Who speak English.
あの人は金がたくさん有る
He has much money―plenty of money―lots of money―heaps of money―no end of money.
日本は雨がたくさん降る
Much rain falls―A great deal of rain falls―in Japan.
海には食物がたくさん有る
There is an abundance of food in the sea―Food is abundant in the sea―Food abounds in the sea―The sea abounds in food―The sea abounds with food.
日本には産物がたくさんある
Japan abounds with products―Japan abounds in products―Japan is rich in products.
日本近海には魚がたくさんいる
The seas about Japan teem with fish.
この本には誤植がたくさんある
There are many misprints in this book―The book is full of misprints.
世の中にはそういう人はたくさんある
There are many such men in the world―The world is full of such men.
あの譜請は金がたくさんかかったろう
The building must have cost a good deal of money―a sight of money.
ご馳走はたくさんある
There is an abundance of good cheer―a power of good things.
志願者がたくさんある
There are a great many applicants―crowds of applicants.
人出がたくさんあった
There was a great crowd of people―a great throng of people.
天には星がたくさんある
There are great numbers of stars in the heavens―Myriads of stars wander through the deep abyss.
日本の沿海には魚類がたくさん取れる
Large quantities of fish are caught in the seas about Japan.
手前どもでは毎日卵をたくさん使います
We consume dozens of eggs every day.
僕は紙をたくさん使う
I use reams of paper.
彼は長所も短所もたくさんある人だ
He has a world of merits and a world of faults.
まあたくさんの本だこと
What a number of books!―What a lot of books!
彼は月給をたくさん取る
He gets much―draws a big salary.
金をたくさん儲ける
He makes much money―He is coining money.
彼は酒をたくさん飲む
He drinks by the gallon―He is a heavy drinker.
たくさん食う
He is a glutton.
どうぞたくさん召し上がれ
I hope you are making a good meal.
たくさん頂戴しました
I am doing very well―I have done ample justice to the dinner.

content:
〈形〉
1. (=充分)enough; sufficient

content.content: 五十円でたくさんか
Is fifty yen enough?―Will fifty yen do?
これだけ有れば当分たくさんだ
This sum will do for the present.
これだけ金が有ったら一生たくさんだ
This sum would last me all my life.
僕は五時間眠ればたくさんだ
Five hours' sleep is enough for me.
賢い人には一言えばたくさんだ
“A word to the wise is sufficient.”
君が座っているばかりでたくさんだ
Your very presence will do.
(肉ですか)もうおたくさんです
No more, thank you.
酒はおたくさんです
I am not taking any wine.
戦争はもうたくさんだ
We have had enough of war.

content: 2. (=満足)(to be) content, contented (with something)

content.content: 今の地位でたくさんだ
I am contented with my present position―My present position is good enough for me.
それだけ金が有ったらたくさんだろう
You ought to be contented with so much money.
金は間に合うだけ有ればたくさんだ
I shall be content with enough money to make both ends meet.
金は要るだけ有ればたくさんだ
I should be content with what money I actually need.

content:
たくする〔託する〕
〈他動〉
1. (=依託する)to entrust, trust (one with something―something to one); to charge (one with a task―one to do something); to give (one) charge of (valuables); to give (one something) in charge; to place (valuables) in one's charge; to place (valuables) under one's charge; to place (valuables) in one's custody; to give (valuables) into one's custody; to give (one something) to keep; to place (valuables) in one's safe-keeping; to give (valuables) into one's safe-keeping; to commit (something) to one's care; to place (something) under one's care; to place (something) in one's hands; to leave (something) in one's hands; to leave (something with one); to commission (one to do something)

content.content: (弁護士に向かって)君に事件を託す
I entrust you with the matter―entrust the matter to you―place the matter in your hands―leave the matter in your hands.
事件を弁護士に託した
I have placed the matter in the hands of a lawyer―entrusted a lawyer with the matter.
事件は君に託しておけば安心だ
The matter is safe in your hands.
事件を託した弁護士
the lawyer entrusted with the matter
弁護士に託した事件
the matter entrusted to the lawyer
金を託された

I am entrusted with the money―The money is entrusted to me―given me to keep―given into my safe-keeping―placed in my safe-keeping―given me in charge―placed in my charge―placed under my charge―placed in my custody―given into my custody―committed to my care―placed under my care―placed in my hands―left in my hands―left with me.
金は君に託しておけば銀行へ預けたも同然だ
The money is safe in your hands.
君にはどんな大金でも安心して託する
I can trust you with any amount of money.
あの男に大金を託するのは剣呑だ
You can not trust him with a large sum of money.
玄関番に伝言を託して来た
I left a message with the door-boy―charged the door-boy with a message.
貴重品は亭主に託した

I gave the valuables in charge to the landlord―gave the landlord charge of the valuables―placed the valuables in the charge of the landlord―placed the valuables under the charge of the landlord―placed the valuables under the care of the landlord―placed the valuables in the custody of the landlord―gave the valuables into the custody of the landlord―gave the valuables into the safe-keeping of the landlord―placed the valuables in the safe-keeping of the landlord.
貴重品は亭主に託してある

The valuables are in the charge of the landlord―under the charge of the landlord―under the care of the landlord―in the custody of the landlord―The landlord is in charge of the valuables―in custody of the valuables.
貴重品を託した人
the man in charge of the valuables
その人に託した貴重品
the valuables in the charge of―under the charge of―the man
君の手荷物を赤帽に託し給え
Give your luggage (in charge) to the porter.
手荷物を託した赤帽
the porter in charge of the luggage
赤帽に託した手荷物
the luggage in the charge of the porter
この子どもを先生に託します
I will place my boy under your care.
店のことはいっさい番頭に託しておきます
I have committed all business to the care of my manager.
医者に生命を託す
to trust one's life to a physician
一身を師の指導に託す
to trust oneself to a teacher's guidance
人に任務を託す
to charge one with a duty
託された任を果たす
to acquit oneself (of the charge)
人に用を託す
to entrust one with a commission―give one a commission―commission one something
買物を託された
I am commissioned to make some purchases.
人に大事を託す
to trust a man with one's affair―confide in one
彼は大事を託すに足る
He is worthy of confidence.
彼に手紙を託した
I charged him with a letter.
手紙を友人に託してやった
I sent the letter by the hand of a friend.
(封筒に書く文句)田中君に託す
Kindness of Mr. Tanaka By favour of Mr. Tanaka.
僕は彼に後事を託して出た
I charged him to look to my affairs during my absence.
彼が死ぬ時後事を託された
He charged me on his deathbed to look to his affairs after he was gone.

content: 2. (=託言する)to pretend; to make a pretence of, make a pretext of, make a plea of (illness, etc.)

content.content: 何に託して
under pretence of―on the pretence of―under pretext of―on the pretext of―under plea of―on the plea of―under colour of―under cover of―under the mask of―under the cloak of―under the veil of―something
彼は病気に託して面会を謝絶した
He declined to see me on the plea of illness―under pretence of illness.
あの男は親切に託して人をだます
He cheats people under colour of friendship―under the mask of friendship.
伝道に託して国を取る
to conquer a country under cover of religion―under the cloak of religion
言を左右に託す
to prevaricate―equivocate―quibble―shuffle―shift and prevaricate
彼は言を左右に託して明らかな返答をせぬ
He only gives evasive answers.

content:
たくみ〔巧み〕
〈名〉(=術、計)art; a design; a trick; an artifice; a scheme; a plot

content.content: あれは巧みの有る女だ
She is an artful woman―a designing woman.
巧みの無い女だ
She is an artless girl.
ここが即ち詩人の巧みというものだ
Herein lies the poet's art.
彼は種々の巧みを用いる
He resorts to various artifices.
彼は何か巧みが有るのでないかしら
I suspect some design―some plot―some trick―on his part.
我々を倒そうという巧みだ
It is a plot to ruin us.
深い巧みだ
It is a deep-laid plot.
あれは深い巧みの有る男だ
He is a deep one.
僕は悪漢の巧みにかかった
I feel a victim to the schemes of a knave.
悪巧み
a wicked design―an evil scheme

content: 〈形〉(=巧者、巧妙)skilful (handling); dexterous (juggling); adroit (management); adept (in the art); ingenious (device); expert (performer); deft (performance); cunning (workman); clever (trick); subtle (artifice); exquisite (workmanship); masterly (art); tactful (teacher); proficient (linguist); good (player):(=に) skilfully; dexterously; adroitly; deftly; ingeniously; cleverly; neatly

content.content: 巧みな細工
cunning workmanship―exquisite workmanship
日本人は細工が巧みだ
The Japanese are cunning workmen.
巧みな工夫
an ingenious device
巧みな仕掛け
an ingenious mechanism
巧みな手際
a dexterous performance―a deft performance
巧みな芸術
a masterly art
巧みな手段
a clever trick―a subtle artifice
彼は巧みな手段で人をだます
He plays clever tricks on people.
彼は人を扱うことが巧みだ
He has tact in dealing with people.
人を操縦することが巧みだ
He is adroit in managing people.
日本人は戦争が巧みだ
The Japanese are skilful in war.
あの先生は授業が巧みだ
He has tact in teaching―He is a good teacher.
英語が巧みだ
He is proficient in English―at home in English.
言いまわしが巧みだ
He has a good command of language.
すべて遊戯が巧みだ
He is a good hand at all games.
ピアノが巧みだ
He is a good pianist―a skilful performer on the piano.
計算が巧みだ
He is quick at accounts.
掛引きが巧みだ
He is a good diplomatist―a consummate diplomatist.
人物を描くことが巧みだ
He shows a masterly hand in the delineation of characters.
官界游泳の術が巧みだ
He is a master in the art of getting on in the official world.
軍略が巧みだ
He is a past master of strategy.
たくさんの糸を片手に持ってこれを巧みにさばく
He holds many lines in one hand, and manipulates them with dexterity.
彼は巧みに人に取り入る

言葉巧みに言いのがれる

巧みに言いのがれた

言葉巧みに説いた

巧みにやってのけた

たくわえ〔蓄え〕
〈名〉
1. Store:(金なら)savings:(惜んで置く金の蓄え)a hoard:(=る) to store (goods in a warehouse―a warehouse with goods); to save, hoard, lay by, put by, set by, lay aside, put aside, set aside (money); to keep (anything)

content.content: 米を蓄える
to store rice
倉に米を蓄える
to store a godown with rice
倉には米が蓄えてある
The godown is stored with rice.
米はたくさん蓄えてある
Much rice is in store―We have large quantities of rice in store.
冬期の蓄えをする
to store food for the winter―lay in stores for the winter
金を蓄える
to save money―hoard money―lay by money―put by money―put aside money
金を蓄えて将来に備える
to provide for the future
若いうちに金を蓄えて老後を養う
Youth should provide for age.
万一の不幸の用意に金を蓄えるべし
One should provide against misfortune―lay by against a rainy day.
たくさんの金を蓄える
to amass wealth―accumulate a fortune
彼は金の蓄えが有るか
Has he any savings?
金の蓄えが無い
He has no savings―He is improvident.
魚を塩漬けにして蓄える
to keep fish salted
塩漬けの魚は長く蓄えておける
Salted fish will keep long.
知識を蓄える
to store one's mind with knowledge
妾を蓄える
to keep a mistress
美髯を蓄える
to wear a beard―wear a moustache
心に蓄える
to harbour―cherish―in one's mind

content:
たくわん〔沢庵〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: たくあん〔沢庵〕

content:
たけ〔丈〕
〈名〉
1. (=身の丈)height; stature; inches

content.content: 彼は丈が高い
He is tall.
丈が低い
He is short of stature.
丈はそう高くない
He is not very tall―He is not a giant in inches.
君は丈が何尺あるか
How many feet do you stand?―What is your stature?
身の丈六尺
He stands six feet―He is six feet in height―He is a six-footer.
丈が伸びる
to increase in stature―grow in height―grow taller

content: 2. (=長さ)length

content.content: 君の着物の丈は何尺着るか
What is the length of your gown?

content: 3. (=ありたけのたけ)all (there is)

content.content: 金をありたけ上げます
I will give you all the money I have.
心のたけを打ち明ける、思いのたけを述べる
to open one's inmost thoughts―open one's heart―lay bare one's mind

content:
たけ〔他家〕
〈名〉Another family

content.content: 他家へ縁づく
to marry into a family

content:
たけ〔茸〕
〈名〉A mushroom

content.content: 茸狩り
mushroom-gathering

content:
たけ〔竹〕
〈名〉The bamboo

content.content: 竹を割る
to split a bamboo
竹を割ったような男だ
He is a straightforward man―an open-hearted man―an impulsive man.
木に竹を接いたよう
They are out of keeping with each other―incongruous.
竹の節
a bamboo-joint
竹のよ
a joint of bamboo
竹の子
a bamboo shoot
竹の皮
a bamboo sheath
竹藪
a bamboo grove
竹垣
a bamboo fence
竹槍
a bamboo spear
竹細工
bamboo-work―bamboo-ware
竹篦
a bamboo spatula
竹釘
a bamboo peg
竹の園生の御身
He is an Imperial prince―He was born in the purple.

content:
だけ〔丈〕
〈副〉［注意］形容詞、前置詞などを用いることあり。
1. (=ただこれだけのだけ)only; but; merely; solely; barely

content.content: ただ一つだけある
There is only one.
ただ三つだけある
There are only three.
ただ五円だけある
I have only five yen.
この木はただ日本だけにある
This tree is found only in Japan.
ただ夢に見ただけさ
I only dreamed it.
彼は金が欲しい時だけやって来る
He comes only when he wants money.
僕はただ自分の義務を尽くしただけです
I have only done my duty.
この犬は人に吠えるだけで食いつきはせぬ
This dog only barks at people; he never bites.
生徒の顔だけ知っている
I know the students only by sight.
試験は形式だけに行うのだ
The examination is gone through only for form's sake.
口約は口約だけのものさ
A promise is but a promise.
ただ死ぬだけのことさ
We can but die.
その時はこの資本を棒に振るだけのことさ
Then I can but lose my capital.
彼は怠けるだけだ
He is only idle―merely idle.
彼ができるのは読み書きだけだ
He can only read and write―merely read and write.
彼は学者とは名だけだ
He is a scholar only in name.
(金を残すところが)借金をせぬというだけだ
I can barely keep out of my debt.
(泳ぐのはさておいて)ただ浮いていたというだけさ
I barely kept myself above water.
ただ約束を履行したというだけだ
He barely kept his word.
彼のはただ及第したというだけだ(尻から何番目位で)
He barely passed his examination.
何でも上げるがこの品だけは上げられません
I will sell you anything but this article.
何でもするがそのことだけはまっぴらご免だ
I would do anything but that.

content: 2. (=あるだけ、要るだけ、できるだけのだけ)all (I have, I want, I can); as much as (I have, I want, I can)

content.content: 金のあるだけ貸そう
I will lend you all the money I have―as much money as I have.
彼は学生にはありがちなことだがあればあるだけ使ってしまう
He spends all he has, as students will.
甲は取るだけ使ってしまう
The one spends all he gets―as much as he gets.
乙は取っただけ貯蓄する
The other saves all he earns―as much as he earns.
(泳ぐはおろか)首を出していただけ(が関の山)
It was all I could do―as much as I could do―to keep myself above water.
要るだけ取れ
Take as much as you want.
金は要るだけ貸して上げよう
I will lend you as much money as you want―any sum you may need.
彼は借りられるだけ金を借りる
He borrows as much money as he can.
走れるだけ走れ
Run as fast as you can.
来られるだけ早く来い
Come as soon as you can―as soon as possible.
読めるだけ本を読め
Read as many books as you can.
食えるだけ果物を食え
Eat as much fruit as you can.
持てるだけ持って行け
Take as many as you can carry.
力に及ぶだけ尽力しよう
I will do all I can―all in my power―I will exert myself as far as I can―as far as lies in my power―so far as in me lies―to the best of my abilities.
記憶しているだけではなんでも一時間ばかり続いたようだ
It lasted about an hour as nearly as I can recollect―as nearly as I can make out.
私は力に及ぶだけの手段を尽しました
I have tried every means in my power.

content: 3. (=できるだけ何々せぬ)as little as one can; no more than one can help

content.content: 僕はできるだけ金を借りないようにしている
I borrow as little money as I can―no more money than I can―no more money than I can help.
できるだけお手数を掛けないように致します
I will give you as little trouble as I can―no more trouble than I can help.
あの人はできるだけ物を言わない主義だ
He makes it a rule to talk as little as he can―no more than he can help.

content: 4. (=あるのはこれだけのだけ)(This is) all (I have)

content.content: 有金はこれだけだ(もう無い)
This is all the money I have.
僕の知っているのはそれだけだ
That is all I know.
それだけか
Is that all?
それだけではあるまい(まだ有るだろう)
I am afraid that is not all―That can not be all.
僕の言いたいことはこれだけではない(まだ有る)
That is not all I have to say.
あんな人を信用するなら君はばかだというだけのことさ
If you trust such a man, your are a fool―that's all.

content: 5. (=要る物はこれだけのだけ)(This is) the only (thing I want)

content.content: 言語を有するは人間だけだ(ほかに無い)
Man is the only creature that can speak (=No other creature can speak)
皇統連綿は日本だけだ
Japan is the only country that boasts an unbroken line of sovereigns.
世界中に通ずる国語は英語だけだ
English is the only language that is spoken all over the world.
成功したのは君だけだ
You are the only man who has succeeded.
僕の友人とては君だけだ
You are the only friend I have―You are my only friend.
僕の欲しいものはそれだけだ
That is the only thing I want.
君の要するものはこれだけか
Is this the only thing you want?
要る物はそれだけではない(ほかにもある)
That is not the only thing I want.
彼の長所は勉強だけではない
Diligence is not his only merit.
誤りはこれだけではない
That is not the only mistake.［注意］“The only”は種類観念の「だけ」、数量観念の「だけ」は前項の“all”を用いる。例えば
僕の財産はこれだけだ
(もう無いの意味なら)―This is all my property(=I have no more property)―(ほかに無いの意味なら)―This is my only property (=I have no other property)

content: 6. (=のみ)alone; only ［注意］前項の“the only”と構文を異にする点に注意せよ。

content.content: 言語を有するは人間だけだ
Man alone can speak―Man is the only creature that can speak.
皇統連綿は日本だけだ
Japan alone boasts an unbroken line of sovereigns―Japan is the only country that boasts an unbroken line of sovereigns.
世界中に通ずるのは英語だけだ
English alone is spoken all over the world―English is the only language that is spoken all over the world.
成功したのは君だけだ
You alone have succeeded―You only have succeeded―You are the only man who has succeeded.
君だけに言おう
I will tell you alone―you only.
君だけに秘密を明かす
I will confide the secret to you alone―The secret is intended for your ears only.
その手紙を君だけに見せよう
I will show the letter to you alone―The letter is intended for your eyes only.
皆行ってしまって僕だけ後に残った
They all went, myself alone remaining behind.
話だけではわからないから現物を見せて下さい
I can form no idea from the description alone, so I should like to see the article for myself.

content: 7. (=何々するだけの)enough to (do something); enough for (some purpose)

content.content: その品物を買うだけの金があるか
Have you enough money to buy the article?
食っていけるだけの収入がある
He has enough income to live on―enough income for a living.
安楽に暮らしていけるだけの財産がある
He has enough fortune for an easy life.
猿は掴んだ米を放すだけの智慧が無い
The monkey has not wit enough to let go the rice in his grasp.

content: 8. (=何々するだけで)the very; the mere; the bare

content.content: 見るだけでたくさんだ
The very sight will do―The mere sight will do.
そんなことを考えるだけで死んでしまう
The very thought would kill me―The mere thought would kill me.
君がすわっているだけでよいのだ
Your very presence will do―Your mere presence will do.
彼の名を聞いただけで皆驚くだろう
They will be astonished at the mere mention of his name―(他動詞構文にすれば)―His very name would astonish them.
想像しただけでぞっとする
I shudder at the bare idea―(他動詞構文にすれば)―The bare idea makes me shudder.
皆彼の足音を聞いただけで震え上がっている
They tremble at the mere sound of his footsteps.

content: 9. (=何々だけは)so far as (it) is concerned; so far as (it) goes; as for (that)

content.content: この本は文章だけは申し分がない
So far as the style is concerned, the book leaves nothing to be desired.
口だけは一人前だ
He counts for one, so far as talking goes.
(人はいざ知らず)僕だけは異存は無い
So far as I am concerned,―As for me,―For my part,―I have no objection.
僕が知っているだけでは彼は洋行をしない
So far as I know, he has never been abroad.

content: 10. (=何々だけでなく)not only (... but also...)

content.content: あの人は勉強だけでなく才もある
He is not only diligent, but also clever.
彼は学問ができるだけでない教え方も上手だ
He is not only a good scholar, but also a good teacher―He is a good teacher as well as a good scholar.
英語だけでないフランス語もできる
He knows not only English, but also French―He knows French as well as English.

content: 11. (=あれだけあっても、あれだけ何々しても)for all; with all; after all

content.content: あれだけ金が有ってもまだ満足しない
For all his wealth, he is not contented.
あれだけ欠点があっても偉いことは偉い
With all his faults, he is a great man.
あれだけ勉強したのに失敗した
He has failed after all his labours.

content: 12. (=これだけ、それだけ、あれだけ)thus much; this much; that much; so much

content.content: これだけは間違い無い、彼はその日不在であったというだけは
This much is certain―Thus much is certain―that he was away from home on the day in question.［注意］この“much”は他の語に換えるかまたはまったく略すこともある。例えば
(仕方をしながら)その動物はこれだけの高さがある
The animal is so high―thus high.
(十円あるか)それだけあったらたくさんだ
That (sum) is enough.
(金が無いから)これだけで辛抱してくれ給え
You must put up with this sum.
これだけあれば当分間に合います
This sum will do for the present.

content: 13. (=何々すればするだけ)the more..., the more...; in proportion as; in proportion to

content.content: あればあるだけ欲しくなる
The more you have, the more you will want.
空中へ登れば登るだけ寒くなる
The higher you go up into the air, the colder it becomes.
南へ行けば行くだけ温かになる
The farther south you go, the warmer it becomes.
早ければ早いだけよし
The sooner, the better.
多ければ多いだけ面白い
The more, the merrier.
忍耐すれば忍耐しただけ成功する
The more you persevere, the better you will succeed―You will succeed in proportion as you persevere―Your success will be in proportion to your perseverance.
国民は戦勝に酔っていただけ失望の度が強かった
Their disappointment was the greater as they were intoxicated with victory.
文明は進めば進むだけ詩が衰える
(In proportion) as civilization advances, poetry declines.

content: 14. (=せめて何々だけ)at least

content.content: せめて樺太の全部だけも欲しかった
We might have had, at least, the whole of Saghalien.
彼は来るか来ないかわからないが用意だけでもしておこう
I will, at least, make preparations for his reception.
彼は(何は無くとも)勉強だけの取柄がある
He has, at least, the merit of diligence.

content: 15. (=さすがは何々だけあって)like the (samurai) that he is; as may be expected from (his character)

content.content: さすがは軍人だけあって従容として死についた
Like the soldier that he was, he faced his death with calmness.
さすがは苦労人だけあって彼は思いやりがある
Like the man who has seen much of life, he has consideration for other's feelings.
氏は欧米の大学を出ただけに当世一流の人物間に顔が売れている
As may be expected from his stay in European and American universities, he is known among the foremost men of the age.

content: 16. (=何々しただけのことがある)not...for nothing

content.content: 彼は洋行しただけのことがある
He has not been abroad for nothing.
新聞記者をしただけのことがある
He has not been on a paper for nothings.
従兄弟だけにどこか似ている
They are not cousins for nothing.
働けば働いただけのことがある
You will not work for nothing―Every man has his due in this world.
忍耐すれば必ず忍耐しただけのことがある
You will not persevere for nothing―Perseverance never fails of its reward.

content: 17. (=何々するだけのことがある)to be worth (doing something)

content.content: この本は読むだけのことがある
The book is worth reading―worthy of a perusal.
そこは行ってみるだけのことはある、行ってみるだけのことはない
The place is well worth a visit―not worth visiting.

content:
〈前置詞〉
18. (=いくつだけ違う)(more or less) by (so many)

content.content: 彼は僕より三つだけ年長だ
He is my senior by three years―three years older than I.
この船はあの船より百トンだけ大きい
This ship is larger than that one by 100 tons.
君は僕より一インチだけ高い
You are taller than I by one inch―one inch taller than I.
この座敷はあの座敷より畳二畳だけ大きい
This room is larger than that one by two mats.
数が五十だけ増した、三十だけ減じた
The number has increased by fifty―decreased by thirty.
金額を百円だけ増してもらいたい
I wish to have the sum increased by 100 yen.
七十五日だけ生き延びる
One's term of existence is increased by seventy-five days.
十年だけ寿命を縮める
to shorten one's natural term of existence by ten years
建築費は千円だけ予算を超過する
The cost of building exceeds the estimate by 1000 yen.
一つだけ多過ぎる
There are too many by one―There is one too many.

content: 19. (=当分だけ)for (the present)

content.content: 暑中だけ(寒中だけ)よそへ行く(避暑をする、避寒する)
I shall be away for the summer―away for the winter.
当分だけここに居る
I shall stay here for the present.
今度だけ僕の言うことを聴いてくれ給え
Listen to me for this once!―for this time!
さすがの頑固親父もあの時だけは主義を曲げた
The rigid disciplinarian for once departed from his principles.

content: 20. (=何々だけは)except

content.content: 僕はたいがいのことは我慢するが嘲弄だけは我慢ができぬ
I can stand anything in reason, except ridicule.
彼の作はたいがい読んだが最近の作だけはまだ読まぬ
I have read all his works, except his latest.

content: 21. (=何々があるだけで)except for

content.content: 土人はふんどし一本締めているだけで丸裸
The natives are naked, except for a loin-cloth.
家には番人がいるだけで空き家同然
The house is deserted, except for the keeper.
市街は当番の巡査がいるだけで人通りが無かった
The streets were deserted, except for the policemen on duty.
彼は怠けるだけで好い人だ
He is a good man, except for his idleness.
欠点はこれだけでまあ無疵の文章だ
The style is faultless, except for this single defect.

content: 22. (=この中からいくらだけ)(so many) out of (the number)

content.content: この中から五冊だけ借りて行く
I shall borrow five volumes out of the number.
この中から十円だけ頂戴します
I will take ten yen out of the sum.

content:
23. 
〈関係代名詞〉(=なけなしのありだけ)what (little there is)

content.content: たんとは無いが持ち合わしただけ出しましょう
I will give what (little) I have about me.
及ばずながらできるだけ尽力しよう
I will do what (little) I can.
(弱っていながらも)残っているだけの力を出して働いた
I worked with what strength I had left.
(彼と深くは付合ってみないが)付合ってみただけでは別に変ったところは無いようだ
From what I have seen of him, there seems to be nothing peculiar about him.

content:
24. 
〈接続詞〉(=どれだけ努めても)However (hard I may try)

content.content: どれだけ勉強しても級について行けない
However hard I may work,―Work as hard as I may,―I can not keep up with my class.
人はどれだけ金があっても徒食するものでない
However rich a man may be,―Be a man as rich as he will,―Be a man ever so rich,―he should not eat the bread of idleness.

content:
25. 
〈名詞〉(=何円だけ、何料だけ)(one yen's) worth (of sugar)

content.content: 茶を三円だけ買ってこい
Get three yen's worth of tea.
十円だけの郵便切手
ten yen's worth of stamps
木戸銭だけの興があった
I have had my money's worth of pleasure.

content:
26. 
〈動詞〉(=何々だけにとどまる、何々だけにとどめる)to be limited to (something); to confine oneself to (something)

content.content: 僕の知っている外国語は英語だけにとどまる
My knowledge of foreign languages is limited to English―English is the only foreign language I know.
語学を研究するなら一カ国だけにとどめるがよろし
If you study languages, you should confine yourself to one.
こういうだけにとどめておこう
I shall content myself with saying that...

content:
27. 
〈以下特例〉

content.content: 人員が二人だけまだ足らぬ
Two men are still wanting.
死体は十だけ出た
Ten bodies have been found.
五冊だけ借りて行く
I shall borrow five volumes.
三円だけ払っておく
I will pay three yen.
どうかこうか首だけだしておった
I managed to keep myself above water.
血は血だけ
“Blood is thicker than water.”
僕の知っているだけではそういう人はないようだ
There is no such man that I know of.
言うだけ野暮だ
That goes without saying―You had better leave it unsaid―One would not take you for anything but what you are.
忙しいだけ儲けは無い
I have much to do and little to get.
あれはあれだけの人間さ
He is not the man to set the river on fire.
彼にだけは話しておく必要がある
He must be let into the secret.
そういって下さるのは貴方だけです
It is kind of you to say so.
これは私だけの考えです
This is my personal opinion.
品が善いだけに値が高い
The quality accounts for the price.
口だけ手が働けば結構だが
There is always much talk and little deed.

content:
たげい〔多芸〕
〈名〉Versatility:(=の) versatile

content.content: 多芸の人だ
He is a versatile man―He can turn his hand to anything.
多芸は無芸
“A Jack of all trades is master of none.”
多芸は身立たず
Versatility does not pay.

content:
たけうま〔竹馬〕
〈名〉Stilts

content.content: 竹馬に乗る
to walk on stilts

content:
たけがり〔茸狩り〕
〈名〉Mushroom-gathering

content.content: 茸狩りに行く
to go mushroom-gathering

content:
たけき〔猛き〕
〈形〉Fierce; intrepid; dauntless; valiant; brave

content.content: 猛き獣
a fierce beast
猛き武夫{ますらお}
a valiant soldier―a dauntless warrior―a brave warrior
さすがに猛き武夫も情にはもろき人心
Brave warrior as he was, he was but mortal and susceptible to female charms.
威あって猛からす
He has a mild dignity.

content:
だげき〔打撃〕
〈名〉A blow

content.content: 個人経営に打撃を与える
to give a blow to private enterprise
新制度は個人経営にとっては大打撃だ
The new system is a great blow to private enterprise.
打撃を蒙る
to receive a blow
彼は投機で大打撃を蒙った
He has been hard hit in speculation.
大打撃
a great blow―a heavy blow―a swingeing blow

content: 2. (=進む)to advance

content.content: もう季節が長けている
The season is advanced.

He is advanced in years.
